PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Must have been fishing when these monsters came. Bad luck.

PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Hm. Wouldn't wish that fate on anyone.

session_synopses.PAD_FightingFishers: Player clicked on a fisher's corpse on the beach that's near an intellect devourer's corpse, and remarks they must have put up a fight.

Dead.speaker: Abducted Nobleman
Dead.text: Guiding my cart... shadow fell... tentacle grabbed me...

Dead.speaker: Abducted Nobleman
Dead.text: Took me here... put something in my eye...

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a merchant, who was kidnapped by the mindflayers and died in the crash. The player can offer to help bury the body or perform any last rites, but they'll be rebuked by the spirit.

PAD_DeadGuide.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadGuide.text: The githyanki from the mind flayer ship. A shame he didn't survive.

session_synopses.PAD_DeadGuide: PAD for when players get closer to the alternative guide's corpse at the crash site. The guide is a gith mage the replaces Lae'zel in the tutorial introduction if Lae'zel is an avatar (he knows Lae'zel). After tutorial ends and players wake up, his corpse will appear nearby (he didn't get magically saved when falling).

AD_KilledMindflayer.speaker: Player
AD_KilledMindflayer.text: Monster. Death is too good for it.

session_synopses.AD_KilledMindflayer: The party comments after killing the mind flayer that lay dying in the wreckage.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeWoundedDevourers: You meet with some Intellect Devourers: walking brains essentially that are nasty creatures. They attack you. As non-gith you have no idea what these things are. As gith, you know very well.

PAD_ShadowheartComment.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartComment.text: Those people... the mind flayer made them its puppets.

session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartComment: Shadowheart realises that some people encountered near the nautiloid crash are being enthralled by an injured mind flayer and have no control over their actions.

session_synopses.Recruitment_AD: As you walk down the road, Astarion calls out to you. He's got something dangerous trapped and needs your help to finish it off.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: "elicited" = "el-iss-it-ed": a soft C, not a hard one.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who tells you where you are: on a river that flows to Baldur's Gate. However, you're probably too far away to get there before the worm in your brain transforms you into a mindflayer.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your skull throbs, your muscles ache. Memories of the last day swim through your head before taking form.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'Zel solo scene, custom cameras may be required.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Summon your resolve. The ghaik tadpole will not be the end of you.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The pain brings the world into focus. Whatever this place, you know Vlaakith's protocol: you must locate a githyanki crèche.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It is only a matter of days before tentacles split your lips, and your skin turns to gore.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At a crèche, you will find your kin. The tadpole will be removed, and you will be purified.*

session_synopses: Laezel wakes up and reflects on what she needs to do after the crash. Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht: VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And when the goblins ally with it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: We'll be on the road to Baldur's Gate.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: When this thing strikes, there will be no soldiers to protect you. This isn't Elturel.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_LeavingAnyCombat1.text: I can't stay here. It's too dangerous.

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsSceneFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you, Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *Your skull briefly aches - and you are her. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsSceneFallback.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsSceneFallback.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsSceneFallback.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: Zorru was right. Yellow as a toad, and twice as ugly.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom scene viewer/cameras for cage shots.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Nymessa
TieflingsScene.text: The thing's dangerous. Leave it for the goblins to kill.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: And if it escapes? How will you - Oh! A guest.
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tieflings notice you in the middle of their conversation.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the prisoner's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows Lae'zel staring at you.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Lae'zel
TieflingsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.InternalNodeContext: Laezel should speak this line telepathically. Her lips should not move.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *Your skull aches before you can take a step - and you are the creature. You feel her irritation and indignity.*

TieflingsScene.speaker: Narrator
TieflingsScene.text: *And you feel answers. She knows more about your condition.*

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: This creature is dangerous. Get out of here - leave it to me!

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: They're right. No one's safe if that thing goes loose.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Player
TieflingsScene.text: A blast? I could use more specifics.

TieflingsScene.speaker: Damays
TieflingsScene.text: You didn't hear it? Shook our camp good, so we came for a look.

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo2: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_OtherDied1: Nymessa reacts to the death of Damayhs at Teifling scene
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat1: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.TieflingsSceneFallback: Edge-case: the normal dialog failed to start. Someone is silenced or wild shaped... Let's just do the midmeld and start combatYou come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.TieflingsScene: You come upon Lae'zel, an alien-looking githyanki trapped in a cage, with two tieflings deciding her fate. Damays thinks its best to take it back to camp to keep an eye on. Nymessa wants to just leave it alone. If Shadowheart is present, she'll warn the player to not trust Lae'zel (she doesn't trust gith due to previous experiences while on a secret mission against them, but doesn't elaborate).
session_synopses.AD_OpenCageLaezel: Lae'zel is still hanging in her cage. She calls to you to let her down.

session_synopses.VB_TrapReuse: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

AD_SanctumStatue.speaker: Narrator
AD_SanctumStatue.text: *You do not recognise the language on the plaque.*
AD_SanctumStatue.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque Selûne pronounced seh-LOON-eh

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Narrator
AD_FL1Mural.context: NodeContext: Narrator describes a plaque written in a dead language

AD_FL1Mural.speaker: Player
AD_FL1Mural.text: A dead tongue. Whoever worshipped here must be long gone.

AD_TrappedTomb.speaker: Narrator
AD_TrappedTomb.text: *The text on the plaque is a mystery to you.*
AD_TrappedTomb.context: NodeContext: Commenting on a plaque written in an unknown language.

session_synopses.AD_SanctumStatue: Reading a bronze plaque at the feet of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.AD_FL1Mural: The player reads a plaque attached to a statue of Selune, the moon goddess. Shadowheart casually mocks it.
session_synopses.AD_TrappedTomb: The player tries to read a bronze plaque in a tomb.

PAD_Jewelry.speaker: Player
PAD_Jewelry.text: Necklace has a Harper sigil. Why were they here?

session_synopses.PAD_Jewelry: Player finds a necklace at the watchtower. If they pass a History check, they recognize it as belonging to the Harpers. If they encountered the Harper documents hidden in the CRA cave, the player senses a pattern.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.text: There! Not so impregnable after all.
VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe.context: NodeContext: Satisfied. She's just successfully lockpicked a large, heavy set of doors.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: ...You're both twice as tall as me but have half the bloody backbone!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minionsNodeContext: Angry, domineering. Short-tempered gang boss berating his underling's caution.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: Whoever was flying that thing can't have survived - whatever's left is up for grabs!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minionsNodeContext: Angry pep talk.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: Now we're going to - Wait! Who're you? And how did you get in there?!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Giimblebock addresses his nearby minions - but turns to you when he realises you're near.NodeContext: Cut off mid sentence by the realisation that the player is nearby. Challenges them. They just appeared through a door that was supposedly secure.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: That crypt's ours - we've got people guarding it! Tryin' to off us and swipe the loot, is it?
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: NodeContext: Anger, with a little confusion. Assumes we're rivals trying to poach his loot.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Player
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: It's mine now. Leave, before things get ugly.

BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.text: C-c'mon, you lot, let's get out of here!
BanditBackInteraction_Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gimblebock addresses his minions, telling them to flee.NodeContext: Nerves showing a little as he orders his underlings to retreat. He's bottled it.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.speaker: Player
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.text: Lucky those bandits valued their own hides over their loot.

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.speaker: Taman
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.text: We'd have been safer in the crypt!
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: reacting with shock on seeing a dead friend

AD_Bandit_Ranger_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Warryn
AD_Bandit_Ranger_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: sees the corpse of a friend, crushed by a boulder. Assumes it's an accident. More complaining than sad.

AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.text: How the hells did that happen?!
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: seeing a companion crushed by a boulder - he thinks it was an accident but is unnerved

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.VB_LockpickingShadowheart_1_WithShadowhe: Shadowheart lockpicked the crypt door that she usually try to bash.
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.
session_synopses.VB_Fissure_1: The player notices a gap in the flooring of an ancient chapel. There's faint signs of something else below.
session_synopses.BanditBackInteraction_Spotted: Right outside of the abandonned chapel of Selune you encounter a few bandits arguing among themselves. They are rightfully surprise to see you get out of the ruins and worried about the fate of their friend inside.
session_synopses.VB_BanditsLeaveReaction: The player comments on how they talked the bandits into leaving (or companions react to the player's successful persuasion).
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees the corpse of one of his companions, killed by a falling boulder
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Ranger_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to the corpse of a dead companion, crushed by a falling boulder
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees one of his friends crushed (dead) by a boulder and doesn't have a great deal of sympathy
session_synopses.Bandit_Melee_01_Dead: Speak with Dead dialogue with Gimblebock - the leader of the bandits who're looting the ruined chapel near where the player first wakes up. Gimblebock's answers are fragmented, cryptic. He can only draw on info that he knew when he was alive, and will refuse to speak to his killer if he recognises them. After a maximum of five questions, he'll fall silent for good.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_1.text: No more prayers... only silence and dust.
VB_Sanctum_1.context: NodeContext: player reflects on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel. Possibly quietly reverential; it's a holy place

AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.speaker: Player
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.text: No lock, no handle. How does it open?
AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation.context: NodeContext: found a door without a lock or handle

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.text: Not even sure this is a door.
AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking.context: NodeContext: Confused - trying to unlock a door in an abandoned chapel that doesn't actually have a lock. She's struggling and muttering to herself

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

VB_Skeleton_2.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_2.text: I wonder what was so subversive about their words that they commanded protection.
VB_Skeleton_2.context: NodeContext: player reacts to companion commenting that skeletons in an abandoned chapel appear to have died without a fight. Slightly unnerved

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: This place is falling apart - could've happened by itself.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.speaker: Haseid
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert.text: No such thing as coincidences when there's loot to be had.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.text: Oh, hells. Something just woke up...
VB_TakingTheArtefact_1.context: NodeContext: just picked up an artefact and heard something awakening in response down in a dungeon - afraid, but with resolve

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: I know when I've got a lock beaten and I didn't beat this one.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe it just broke by itself. This place is ancient.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Further weak effort at explaining the unexplainable.

AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.text: Maybe. But keep on your guard.
AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Something doesn't add up.

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: No more prayers... only dust and silence.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart.text: Who were those prayers for? Normally the patron god is obvious - not here.

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1: players reflect on an the abandoned inner sanctum of a long-abandoned chapel
session_synopses.AD_UpDownDoorInvestigation: player finds a door that has no lock or handle
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerLockpicking: A bandit in an abandoned chapel - she's trying and failing to open a door to the lower level of the chapel, searching for loot. Talking to herself as she struggles - confused by the fact the door doesn't have a lock.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_2: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert: Three bandits - Barton, Mari and Haseid - are on alert in a crypt they're attempting to rob. They heard a commotion (falling masonry) and are braced for threats.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_TakingTheArtefact_1: The player just stole a relic from a crypt in an abandoned chapel, and all candles around it sputtered out. Sounds of movement come from another room...
session_synopses.AD_BanditOpenDoorBanter: Mari has found the door to lower level open but she did not unlock it. She talks to her comrade, Barton about it.They debate what must have happened.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithShadowheart: Players have entered an abandoned chapel dedicated to an unknown god. Shadowheart is puzzled as to why she can't figure out who was the patron of this place.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If it ain't the friendly drow. Thought you were with the goblins when you showed up at the gate.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Glad you weren't - you fight well. Not like them bloody tieflings.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You fought well, too.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Half my crew are full of holes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed, slightly sad

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Now I'm gonna take the blame for leading the goblins here, and losing track of the bloody druid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He knows these things are his fault, but he's sulking and petulant about it

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did the goblins come from?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: They chased us all the way from the ruins we were poking around in.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And is that where you lost track of the druid you mentioned?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Aye. His name's Halsin, and if he's still alive, he'll be cursing the day he laid eyes on me.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We've got a contract to track down some relic, and he wanted in on the job. Eyes lit up when he heard about it.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I have a look at that contract?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Job's all yours, if you got a death wish.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'You can have it, buddy'

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: There's a wizard in Baldur's Gate that'll pay gobloads for a relic, supposedly buried round these parts.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Flippant

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any idea what the relic actually is?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If I knew that, I wouldn't be back here with half my crew gone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Bitter and sarcastic

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: But look, if you're itching to meet Kelemvor, I won't stop you.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Disrespectful

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

AD_Training.speaker: Wyll
AD_Training.text: Good work, kids. You're all heroes, each and every one of you.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Good try. But don't just swing all pell-mell.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Wyll
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Swing, count a beat, and swing again.

session_synopses.AD_Training: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

AD_LookingForInstrument.speaker: Alfira
AD_LookingForInstrument.text: No, no, no. It was right here.
AD_LookingForInstrument.context: NodeContext: Frantic and panicked as you search for your instrument.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Narrator
Animals.text: *The critters start a duet of their own, attempting to drown out the bard's music. They look at you expectantly.*
Animals.context: NodeContext: watching a bird and a squirrel sing together

Animals.speaker: Player
Animals.text: Bravo. You could go on tour, with talent like that.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.text: Of course - we are born performers.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: throwing shade at the bard, snickering

session_synopses.AD_LookingForInstrument: The bard is looking for her instrument in the vicinity of her playing spot.
session_synopses.Animals: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.

AD_WyllCharge.speaker: Wyll
AD_WyllCharge.text: By sickle and sword, strike them down!

Adventurer1.speaker: Barth
Adventurer1.text: Damn coward's got plenty to answer for.
Adventurer1.context: NodeContext: Goblins are defeated, but party isn't behind the gates yet.

AdventurerLeader.speaker: Aradin
AdventurerLeader.text: Out of my way. I'll tear the horns off that bloody coward!
AdventurerLeader.context: NodeContext: Furious at Zevlor, who nearly locked him out of the grove.

Adventurer2.speaker: Remira
Adventurer2.text: Said it from the start. Shouldn't have trusted those foulbloods.
Adventurer2.context: NodeContext: Very nasty. All-but-saying a slur re: tieflings

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.text: Scouts - get to the high ground. Raiders - charge the bastards!
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: Shouting commands to his troops as they enter combat

AD_GoblinCaptain.speaker: Za'krug
AD_GoblinCaptain.context: NodeContext: A warcry to his new god, the Absolute

AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.text: The danger has passed - for now. Open the gates.
AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a high pointl

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Open up or I'll break the bloody thing down!

AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.speaker: Aradin
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.text: Look - please, just let us in. They're almost on us.
AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate.context: NodeContext: Still angry but trying to be reasonable.

VB_ApproachingGate.speaker: Player
VB_ApproachingGate.text: We should check it out - but be careful.

AD_Adventurer1AtGate.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.text: Hurry! Please! The goblins are on us!
AD_Adventurer1AtGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking up at Zevlor.NodeContext: Panicked and terrified. About to die.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: Was that an ordinary raid? Seemed a fool's errand.

PAD_RaidersDefeated.speaker: Player
PAD_RaidersDefeated.text: They likely have a camp nearby. I'd expect more raiders eventually.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: He'll feel that in the morning.

PAD_ConfrontationResolved.speaker: Player
PAD_ConfrontationResolved.text: Now that that's settled, we can get to finding a healer.

OpenGate.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate.text: That was the last of them. Inside - all of you. More may follow.
OpenGate.context: NodeContext: Shouted down to us - at the bottom of the gate

OpenGate.speaker: Zevlor
OpenGate.context: CinematicNodeContext: Zevlor calls for gate to open (custom camera)NodeContext: Calling out o someone standing on his level, but not extremely close.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: You led them to our door.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: And you was ready to let 'em have us.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersArgue.text: Don't blame me for your idiotic mistakes.

AD_LeadersArgue.speaker: Aradin
AD_LeadersArgue.text: I blame you for lockin' us out. Leavin' us to die.

AD_TieflingWakesUp.speaker: Zevlor
AD_TieflingWakesUp.context: NodeContext: Aradin just punched him in the face. This is him waking up after getting knocked out.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.context: NodeContext: Situation didn't pan out very well - but no-one died. Slightly relieved but unsure.

VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves.context: NodeContext: Someone has remarked 'it could have been worse'

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinCaptain: A goblin veteran leading a raid on a druid grove - he's giving orders to his troops
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderWantsGateOpened: The tiefling leader calls for the doors to be opened with an AD if players are outside of dialog range.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerLeaderAtGate: Plea from the adventurer leader at the gates - goblins are almost here, he needs Zevlor to open up! Zevlor is being circumspect.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeaderRant: Rant the tiefling leader says before going off to meet the adventurers after the goblin raid.
session_synopses.VB_ApproachingGate: VB played when the players are approaching the gates of the DEN.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer1AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.OpenGate: The goblins have been narrowly beaten. From on top of the tall front gate, Zevlor shouts down to us, then to someone relatively on his level to open the gate.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingWakesUp: Player when the tiefling leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.
session_synopses.VB_AdventurerLeaderLeaves: VB played after the adventurer leader has fled the DEN in Raiding Party.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Another outsider? This place has certainly become popular.
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arron turns around and wipes his hands on his trousers (he was standing at a table, with his back to the player).

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Well met, and thank you for beating back those goblins. Most brave of you.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Is there anything you need? Act fast if you do - the ritual will be complete before too long.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: What ritual are you talking about?

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ah - I forgot you're a blow-in. A few days hence, this grove will be completely concealed by thorny vines.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: None will be able to enter - or leave.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: A drastic measure. But more monsters seem to terrorise this region every day.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: We druids will be safe. As for those that took refuge here... well, may Silvanus guard them as they continue their travels.

005.speaker: Player
005.text: Seems like most are tieflings. They'll be fine. They have devilish powers.

005.speaker: Arron
005.text: Ignorance is agony, my friend. I will include you in my prayers. I'd better get started - for your sake.

002.speaker: Marcoryl
002.text: You may have won over Kagha, but I'm not so easily swayed.

003.speaker: Loic
003.text: Shadow Druids... To think we were rotting from within. I'm sorry. I need a moment.
003.context: InternalNodeContext: TODO: Add Shadow Druid Flag. Reaction for after the player exposed the Shadow druid plot. I don't know if he'll be part of the druids who fight alongside Sagha (I don't know if all pro-sagha druids do). But this works both if Sagha got convinced and if she's dead.NodeContext: They just discovered that their boss was being influenced by an evil organisation.

session_synopses.005: Arron is a friendly, but tired servant to the druids in the grove. Unless the player is a druid, he would rather they don't linger, though he is sympathetic and will help them any way he can (by selling them supplies). He is happy to see a druid and to help them. He can be a little preachy.
session_synopses.002: A very condescending and somewhat objectionable druid servant. He believes the tiefling refugees hiding in the grove have brought chaos and would gladly be rid of them, even if turning them away would doom them.
session_synopses.003: An elderly druid who would like nothing more than for the player to leave. Depending on what the player has done, he will be civil about it, but still incistent. If the child has died, he is openly hostile.

003.speaker: Topaz
003.text: Shh, I'm concentrating. Does this look good? Is the coin in the middle?
003.context: NodeContext: Clearly concentrating on something else while talking to the player. He's pushing the coin around.

003.speaker: Player
003.text: Kick at the bird, trying to scare it away.

003.speaker: Topaz
003.context: NodeContext: The player just kicked the bird.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Another stranger come to vex me. What will you do? Hunt me? Grab my tail? Shout until my head hurts?
002.context: NodeContext: This is a wild animal and the wrong move might endanger us

002.speaker: Player
002.text: Relax. No one is here to hurt you.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Stupid or a liar. Neither is needed here. Go!

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Hmph. I thought you were Halsin.

004.speaker: Narrator
004.text: *The boar prances around, haunches clenching and unclenching impatiently.*
004.context: NodeContext: the player is describing the feelings of a tame boar that is hoping we've brought it something it craves - it's quite desperate

004.speaker: Tusk
004.text: Where's Halsin? He promised me a mate!

session_synopses.003: Speak with animals dialogue. A little bird is adding a coin to the shinies in his nest, but he's not confident it's looking good.
session_synopses.002: An aggravated wolf in a druid grove. He has learned obedience from Rath but is still a wild thing at heart. There are newcomers to his home and his instincts tell him to chase them away, to harm them, but he's not allowed to. He's like a coiled spring, ready to strike.
session_synopses.004: A tame boar in the druid grove who craves the company of his own kind
session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

AD_Shared.speaker: Bex
AD_Shared.text: What will we do for work when we get to the city?

AD_Shared.speaker: Bex
AD_Shared.text: I think I'd make a fine teacher. Or a baker. Or a butcher.

AD_Shared.speaker: Danis
AD_Shared.context: NodeContext: Surprise she'd say she wants to be a butcher

AD_Shared.speaker: Danis
AD_Shared.context: NodeContext: Bex has just said something strange, he's pretending to kind of ignore it.

session_synopses.AD_Shared: The two young lovers are enthusiastically making plans for when they arrive in Baldur's Gate.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Mirkon
AfterHarpyEncounter.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering in fear (he's hunkering down, with his hands over his face/ears). Scripter note: Use the generic cower or some approximation for consistency with scripter animations.

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Player
AfterHarpyEncounter.text: They're gone. Are you all right?

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome isn't looking at the player, but in the direction the singing comes from.NodeContext: in awe, entranced. Trying not to disturb the singer.

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.text: CinematicNodeContext: Harpy flies in and perches menacingly on the rock, while she keeps singing
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harpy flies in and perches menacingly on the rock, while she keeps singing

CharmedVictim_Wildshape.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim_Wildshape.text: Yes, everything's gonna be fine... once I get there...

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AfterHarpyEncounter: Non-critical path. The player has just saved the child from harpies that had enchanted and tried to eat him. He's shy and still scared.
session_synopses.CharmedVictim_Wildshape: Non-critical path. Unless the player has snapped him out of it, the boy will be enchanted and wanting to get closer to the source of the song.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeCharmed: The tiefling kid has been charmed, and is being controlled by a beautiful song that beckons him forth, promising everything will be all right if he follows.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerUncharmed: AD played when player wakes up from being charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeUncharmed: The tiefling kid wakes up fron his trance, he's panicked and (almost) crying because he's so frightened.

session_synopses.DEN_PleaAtTheGate_Adventurers: World behaviours for Aradin and the group, they are banging at the gate

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Wotcher messin' with my cage for?
Caged.context: NodeContext: spoken when player tampers with her cage while she's locked up - curious

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Didn't expect to see a drow in here. Did the boss lady send you to rescue me?

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Another drow - she's one of my best mates. Thought you might work for her.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: A goblin healer? That's a new one. But she might be the only way to keep our skulls intact.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: She's worth talking to, at least.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.text: That goblin won't be the last.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Player
GuardsIdle.text: It was a nice shot, if nothing else.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.context: NodeContext: Processing the fact. In the next line, she'll be resolved to kill more goblins

Dead.speaker: Sazza
Dead.context: NodeContext: cold, emotionless, speaking with her corpse

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.PAD_Healer: Played after being told by Sazza about Gut.Speaker 1 is the character who left the dialog. Neutral inquisitive remark about whether the rumoured healer could really help.Speaker 2 is any other party member. Line can be opinionated.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.GuardsIdle: Arka and Memnos are idle in the druid grove after going to confront the captive goblin Sazza. The goblin may or may not have been killed in this prior scene. Arka remains bitter over the recent death of their friend, Kagha, while Memnos, if present, tries to shake her out of it.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with Sazza, the captured goblin at the grove.

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *It seems Mol was as good as her word. She's reported that you've been threatening children.*

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Player
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: Children? I haven't spoken to any children.

Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.speaker: Narrator
Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime.text: *Your words may be false, but they ring truer than Mol's tales. You're off the hook.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *Your rescue attempt has been noticed. Choose your next move carefully.*

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Player
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: Anyone who wants to hurt Sazza will face me first.

CapturedGoblin_Crime.speaker: Narrator
CapturedGoblin_Crime.text: *You are persuasive enough. You, and the goblin, are free to go.*

GroveConflict_IdolCrime.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolCrime.text: *It seems the Idol of Silvanus has been stolen. Choose your next move carefully.*

session_synopses.Thieflings_HideoutTrespassCaught_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when a guard confronts players who have offended Mol, teenage crime boss in the Druid Grove. The player can try talk their way out of trouble, attempt a bribe, fight or surrender.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_Crime: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player is trying to smuggle the goblin out of the Druid Grove.
session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolCrime: The player has stolen a most sacred idol from the druids.Though the druids have made peace with the players and the tieflings at this time, they can't let anyone steal their idol, so they interrogate the player when they see him.

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolStolen.text: The idol is gone. Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolStolen: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been stolen. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

PAD_DiscoverTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverTrap.text: I don't like the look of that mushroom. I should stay clear.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverTrap: The player has discovered a hostile looking mushroom in the DEN Grove Prison. It's origins are from the Underdark, but have been planted by an inquisitive druid.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: You have good timing. Never been much of a fighter, so wrestling a bugbear would have gone poorly.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: But you're not here for heroics, are you? Avernus' stench is all over your skin.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Let me guess: your devil mistress sent you to get her soul coin back. Too bad. I earned it fair and square.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: Oh man, a soul coin? Wouldn't mind getting my hands on that...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very interested but maybe downplaying her interest.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That bugbear would have crushed your skull. This is the thanks I get?

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Why thank you, dread slayer of bugbears. You shall live forever in my memory.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dramatically exaggerated/sarcastic.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Now take my regards back to that pouting erinyes and leave me alone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very flat, almost cold.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How about this? You give me the coin. Now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You hand the coin over, or I kill you. How about that?
True

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Considering you turned that bugbear into paste...

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: ...that's a good trade. Except the coin seems to have slipped through a hole in my pocket somewhere. Damn it.

session_synopses: Nadira is a witty tiefling that survived Avernus and escaped with a soul coin, a valuable currency of the Hells. She suspects the player works for the original owner of the coin, a devilish erinyes, and will have to be persuaded in order to hand it over.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Thanks for fighting off those goblins. If you need to replace any gear, just ask.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: My selection's pretty slim. I had to leave most of my equipment in Elturel.

PostEA.speaker: Player
PostEA.text: That forge is holding on by a thread. Are you a smith?

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Of sorts. Used to be a bread-and-butter tinsmith before Elturel fell into Avernus. These days my talents are more... eclectic.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Learned a lot in my time in the Hells. Hope to forget most of it, but between you and me, there's nothing in all the realms like the utter power of infernal machinery.

PostEA.speaker: Dammon
PostEA.text: Alas - my offerings are far more humble these days.

session_synopses.PostEA: Players can approach a tiefling blacksmith. He used to have a proper forge in Elturel, but is now trying to make do in the grove. The gear he has available is usable, but not great.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Wyll
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: Harsh. Remind me to stay on your good side.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: You were never on my good side.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: First you save us from goblins, then Kagha's treachery. You're making your mark.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.NodeContext: Examining injured bird. Glances up from her work to look at player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Give me a moment. I'll be right with you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the playerNodeContext: Looks back to the injured bird after glancing at the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Excuse me? I'm more important than some bird.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: God or fieldmouse, no one's more important than the patient in front of you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still working on the birdNodeContext: Working on bird, doesn't look up at player

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what was it you needed?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Turns to player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I need help. Now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Just be glad my bedside manner's better than yours.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come here. Let's have a look at you.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine themNodeContext: Approaches the player to examine them

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You seem healthy enough. A bit tired 'round the eyes, maybe.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.NodeContext: Examines the player, carefully looking them up and and down.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No good way of putting this. I... uh... have a tadpole in my head.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A tadpole? A mind flayer tadpole?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suddenly grave, giving you her full attention. A mind flayer is an incredibly dangerous creature.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You know of them? Can you help me?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: I - I'll do what I can.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sadly. She's realising she'll have to kill the player.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Come, follow me. I might be able to help.
node_data.context: NodeContext: In command, but grave. She's decided she has to kill the player.

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: Halsin would have known what to do. Damn it all.

Bird.speaker: Tingmiaq
Bird.text: To find Halsin. There's not a moment to lose!

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: I don't want to hurt you - but I have to protect the others.

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.text: They did a number on you, didn't they?
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Sadly

AD_WithBird.speaker: Nettie
AD_WithBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hunched over the bird, moving hands over it.NodeContext: Gently, as if to a child

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Something took a chunk out of you. What happened?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird says nothing, trying to rest.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird's injured wing

WoundedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
WoundedBird.text: Big dog - gnoll... I got too close...

WoundedBird.speaker: Player
WoundedBird.text: Where did you see these gnolls?

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *The bird lapses into silence, her head lolling to the side.*

WoundedBird.speaker: Narrator
WoundedBird.text: *She lies limply on the table, completely still.*
WoundedBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player prods the bird. No response.

PAD_FeelingSick.speaker: Player
PAD_FeelingSick.text: I don't feel too good. What did that druid scratch me with?
PAD_FeelingSick.context: NodeContext: Poison is slowly taking effect. You don't feel great, but it's nothing serious yet.

Stayed.speaker: Nettie
Stayed.text: I hear you brought Kagha back from the brink. My thanks.

Stayed.speaker: Nettie
Stayed.text: But what about your other mission? Any word on Master Halsin?

Stayed.speaker: Nettie
Stayed.text: Please hurry - for both your sakes.

PAD_Relieved.speaker: Player
PAD_Relieved.text: I can feel the poison clearing - I'm cured!

HealedBird.speaker: Wounded Bird
HealedBird.text: There was so much noise out there. I'm glad you're okay.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: Looks like Halsin's our best bet for a cure.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We need to find him, before it's too late.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: What if something happened to him?

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: All the more reason to hurry.

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: Yes? Is there anything I can do?

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.context: NodeContext: A little sadly. She wants to save you, but feels that she morally can't.

LockedUp.speaker: Player
LockedUp.text: We can both see I have no symptoms - I'm not about to change!

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: Same as the drow... But Master Halsin said he'd turn eventually.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.WoundedBird: Wounded bird is resting on the table after being treated by Nettie. It's probably going to die. If you poke it repeatedly, it will die.
session_synopses.PAD_FeelingSick: |The player has the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN on them. This status has 3 stages leading to death. The player is slowly dying.The first stage is right after being stung by Nettie in the situation Halsin's Apprentice (the reaction of the player is covered in the dialog DEN_Apprentice_Cyanide).This PAD plays after a long rest: the player rested but the status is worsening. The status is getting to stage 2 and then to stage 3, each time having worse gameplay effects.After stage 3, the status kills the player; the PAD DEN_Apprentice_PAD_Dying plays in that case.|
session_synopses.Stayed: After the scene where she scratches you. Player persuaded Nettie and accepted to take her poison. She told them their only hope is Halsin. Nettie is back in her room, she's working.
session_synopses.PAD_Relieved: The player is cured from poison ( the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN). This status has 3 stages leading to death. Each time the player make a long rest, they get closer to death.This PAD of relief plays only if the status reached the stages 2 or 3. The status was getting worse and worse, which must have been worrying, but now they've been cured.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.AD_ToStorage: Nettie has arrived with the 'infected' player and is  gesturing for them go into the storage unit.
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

PAD_FirstInsight.speaker: Player
PAD_FirstInsight.text: I'd swear that ox's gaze is following me.

session_synopses.PAD_FirstInsight: The player walks past and, if they notice (pass an insight check), responds to the ox looking at them strangely.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Ah. I've already spoken to your travelling companion. Well met.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Polite

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: I'd advise you to settle your affairs here quickly.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grim, lot on his mind

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Once the druids complete their ritual, we'll be sharing the road with goblins once again.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Frustrated but resigned

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Unless you've reconsidered speaking to them for us? Kagha might listen to you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: We turned him down before - he's hopeful that we might change our mind

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll speak to the druids.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll see what I can do.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: I knew I liked you.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: We'd owe you a great debt. If we're forced to leave now, more of my people will die.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: You'll find the druids at the heart of the grove. Please - make them see sense, before more lives are lost.

node_data.speaker: Zevlor
node_data.text: Oh, and if it's of any concern... you're brave to walk around without hiding your heritage. I'll make sure everyone knows that you helped us at the gate.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Addressing an awkward topic before he forgets - most would run from your race on sight, but he's reassuring us that we're welcome

HeadedToCave.speaker: Zevlor
HeadedToCave.text: Find me in the caves. I need to let people know we're moving.
HeadedToCave.context:
InternalNodeContext: Player clicks on Zevlor while he is getting back to his default position in the cave after the confrontation.
When Zevlor finally reaches the cave, his dialog is switched to DEN_TieflingLeader

session_synopses: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. In the same dialogue, we can also uncover that he is in fact a traitor, concerned only with getting these people through the goblins so he can trade them for his own safety later. In truth he is resentful and contemptuous of them, viewing them as weak.
session_synopses.HeadedToCave: |Zevlor's default dialog need a timeline context, so this dialog here is used as a transition when Zevlor is walking back to his default spot after a big event happened in the Grove. There's 2 cases: after the raiding party and after druid attack.|

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
2.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

session_synopses.2: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

AD_Grumpy.speaker: Zurga
AD_Grumpy.text: Where do druids keep their liquor?
AD_Grumpy.context: NodeContext: irritated - just raided a grove and there's not a lot of good loot

AD_ChefAndSon.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSon.text: We'll make it last. We always do.

AD_ChefAndSon.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSon.text: I can't thin the broth much more than this.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: Looking well, folks - keep it up.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Asharak
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: I'm not 'sir'. I was a doorjack in Elturel.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Pandirna
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.context: NodeContext: Repeating what her companion was saying mockingly.

AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.speaker: Guex
AD_TrainerAtOilBarrels.text: Shut it, you - and help me with these barrels.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: We did it. Come on, give me a kiss.

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Hold still! I'll kiss you when you've stopped bleeding, you lummox.
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: Concentrating on seeing to his wounds. Gentle admonishment

AD_LoversWithoutGuard.speaker: Bex
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.text: Yes, you are. Now stop squirming!
AD_LoversWithoutGuard.context: NodeContext: 'I love you and share in your happiness but you're being pain in the arse right now'

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Not so bad as burning goblin will, I'd wager.
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: With bravado, playing at experience in war.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Pandirna
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: It seems... cruel, when you say it like that.

AD_FillingOilBarrel.speaker: Guex
AD_FillingOilBarrel.text: Cruel? Imagine what they'd do to us, given half the chance.
AD_FillingOilBarrel.context: NodeContext: As if he's never heard anything so stupid.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Look at this place. Like a pen of hogs waiting for the butcher's knife. We need to act!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Quiet! Some of the children might hear you.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Oh, perish the thought they overhear a little honesty once in their short lives -

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Another word and it won't be the goblins you have to worry about!

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: That's to say me at the front while the others stay back and do as I say?

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: Shut it just for once, you insufferable, oafish -

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio.text: Stop it! Listen to someone else for once.
ProdigyTrio.context: NodeContext: Exasperated - gesturing to the player to continue.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Player
ProdigyTrio.text: Rolan front and centre - you two don't want to get caught in his crossfire.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Lia
ProdigyTrio.text: There you go, Rolan - the glory of dying first is all yours. Happy?

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Rolan
ProdigyTrio.text: Exceedingly happy. But I won't be dying.

ProdigyTrio.speaker: Cal
ProdigyTrio.text: That's as close to an agreement as we're likely to get. Let's keep it that way.

AD_LookingForDoni.speaker: Rikka
AD_LookingForDoni.text: Doni! I don't want to lock you outside, please.
AD_LookingForDoni.context: NodeContext: More quietly than her other shouts, as much to herself.

AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.speaker: Rozzak
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.text: Good work - the True Souls are proper pleased.
AD_WarchiefBraveVictory.context: NodeContext: calling out to other goblins after a victory

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: Admiring my beautiful barricades? Might not be pretty, but they'll stop a charging worg.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can leave your valuables with me if you like.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: Goblins strip the dead down to the last stitch, so I hear.
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: Knowingly, trying to freak player out

RobberKid.speaker: Player
RobberKid.text: Best pray they don't kill me, then - they'll get you next.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: So you say - survived Avernus, though. More than you've done.
RobberKid.context: NodeContext: Dismissive. Some insane goblins don't scare him.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: Can you two help? Anything you don't pack is getting left behind.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Meli
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: We can always get more stuff later.

AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeaderScolding.text: You won't get there if we starve on the way. Gonna rob your friends when you're hungry?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: I pray next time I square up to a goblin, you're there again.

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Goblin kids would 'ave put up a better fight.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious - describing a child who tried to fight back during an attack

RaiderMurderous.speaker: Warrior Rua
RaiderMurderous.text: Killed my first human when I was five years old. Tieflings are soft.
RaiderMurderous.context: NodeContext: malicious glee - talking about killing a tiefling child

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.text: I wish I could help on the walls, but... I wasn't a soldier, really. Just a trumped-up guard.

Refugee002.speaker: Danis
Refugee002.context: NodeContext: He gives up on trying to come up with an excuse - frightened and apologetic.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: ... and over the horizon they saw a ship, like some great beast bursting from the waves.

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: The Wandering Eye, the jewel of Balduran's fleet! So named because -
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Moment of a story where hero returns

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: - well... because Balduran travelled far and... saw much.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Catching herself, realizing children might not understand concept of Wandering Eyes

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: But he had finally come home to save the city he loved!

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: He drove the raiders away and raised a wall to protect his people.
AD_KidStory.context: NodeContext: Happy ending, reassuring them that evil was defeated

AD_KidStory.speaker: Alfira
AD_KidStory.text: And so they named the city to honour him. Balduran's - Baldur's Gate.

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.
BackupLeader.context: NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

BackupLeader.speaker: Cerys
BackupLeader.text: Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.
