AfterRelease_Bear.context: CinematicNodeContext: [reuse] Animal ConstructionInternalNodeContext: Bear allied with player against goblins.

Worg_002.speaker: Tale
Worg_002.text: Fur. Can't you smell the fur? Fur and meat. Lots of MEAT!

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his bear form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Kid_001: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear
session_synopses.AfterRelease_Bear: After the goblins release the bear its asks you if you will help him to kill them.
session_synopses.Worg_002: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transformed into a bear.
session_synopses.CombatCutscene_Bear: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. The bear attacks the door that flies away and potentially kill a goblin.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

Trader.speaker: Player
Trader.text: Let me see what you have.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: Sorry - I don't want any trouble.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Best see the priestess and get branded, mucker.
Goblin007.context: NodeContext: He has been branded (by choice) and his arm is badly burned. He's too drunk to care too much though

Goblin007.speaker: Player
Goblin007.text: Can this priestess heal people too, or does she just brand them?

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: Heh. Seen 'er carve more folk than she's cured. Still, she's a Chosen o' the Absolute now.

Goblin007.speaker: Warlock Gurk
Goblin007.text: See for y'self. Head inside, and follow the sound o' squealin' novices.

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
DwarfOperator000.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator000.text: They look quite fetching on you.

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

Goblin003.speaker: Brawler Rot
Goblin003.text: Wass holdin' up the game? Chicken ain't dead is it?

Goblin004.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.speaker: Eight
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.text: Oi, get off! I killed him - he's mine!
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.context: CinematicNodeContext: planer knelt looting bodyNodeContext: wave hands to shoo looting player.

GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.speaker: Narrator
GoblinKid002_LootingCrime.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin007: A somewhat zealous goblin eager to tell us about the mark that the Absolute's followers have branded onto their flesh
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Goblin003: This goblin is a spectator - initially of a bard singing a song in which he's not partcularly interested, and later of a game of chicken chase
session_synopses.Goblin004: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.
session_synopses.GoblinKid002_LootingCrime: An unpleasant goblin kid's crime reaction on looting dead adventurer's body.

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.Trespassing: This goblin is nearly blackout drunk and unsteady on his feet, but still trying to perform guard duties.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Hold up your hands to show you mean no harm.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking aboutNodeContext: SFX only

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Kneel down - you won't hurt him.

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *You notice a shiver run through his feathered coat - fear, a desperate longing for the safety of his nest.*

Owlbear.speaker: Narrator
Owlbear.text: *But his mother is gone - taken. All that's left are these creatures.*

Owlbear.speaker: Player
Owlbear.text: Offer him your hand. He can follow your scent to your camp in the wilderness.

Owlbear.speaker: Owlbear Cub
Owlbear.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cub tilts head, considering player, then backs away and leaves.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record.

session_synopses.Owlbear: This owlbear has been captured by the goblins. It is a cub and has been tormented by the goblins. In this dialog the player can reassure it, guide it to safety, or encourage it to attack the goblins. If the player has convinced his captors to release him, they can invite him to their camp. The owlbear refuses - but will show up later on his own.
session_synopses.GameOver: The Chase is over, the commentator tells the player to approach her.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Tozad
node_data.text: If yer plannin' to talk ta the drow, watch yerself - she's in a right mood.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous and deferential (when speaking to a drow) Insulting (when speaking to a Tiefling)  Friendly word of advice (if speaking to neither a drow or tiefling).

session_synopses: A female goblin grunt. Nervous and respectful to drow, insulting towards tieflings. World-weary and advisory to others.

Melee_01.speaker: Yerle
Melee_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, stony-faced. You keep trying to talk to her and she has no interest.

Caster_01.speaker: Erna
Caster_01.text: You don't want to go in there. Really.
Caster_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, more serious. The previous warning was an attempt to be friendly, but we're pushing our luck now and the humour's gone.

session_synopses.Melee_01: This guard is more aggressive than her counterpart. She's a thug/bouncer, and you're trying to stick your nose where you have no business.
session_synopses.Caster_01: This mercenary is guarding the entrance to a supply of incredibly rare and explosive material. She's trying to strike a more reasonable tone than the other guard we speak to.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You look like you could kick the arse of half the scrubs in here. Bunch of drunken layabouts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Appraising of player.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Not me though. I'm as hard as they come, an' I'm itchin' for another fight.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Proud.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Another fight? You should enjoy the spoils of the last one.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: I've had my fill of feastin'. Rest of 'em can get fat and fuddled - I wanna kill somethin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Restless.

session_synopses: Sober goblin, tough, itching for a fight.

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Seen this mess? Flamin' Fist thuggo took a chunk outta me arm last raid out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's holding her arm up to playerNodeContext: Speaks to the player slightly more as an equal - they've been accepted into the camp thus far, after all. She's displaying a nasty wound

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You fought Flaming Fist?

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: That last inn we 'it. They were guardin' some uppity noble 'n his friends.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost bored at the story - she's describing an incident of great significance to you but she only cares about the fight and the spoils it brings

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Not very well, mind. Drow carried him off, left the real spoils to us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Snorting, derisive. Both of the mercenaries who couldn't put up a fight, and of the fact that the drow only cared about taking hostages, leave the real valuables (in her eyes) behind

session_synopses: Non crit-path. This goblin is recounting stories of her last raid and displaying a wound. It's less a cause of pain than a subject for boasting.

Guard.speaker: Gribbo
Guard.context: NodeContext: Volo is gone; Guard has no real function so is just a mean, stupid drunk.

session_synopses.Guard: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

Branding.speaker: True Soul Gut
Branding.text: Ready to figure out what's goin' on with those shadows in your head?

session_synopses.Branding:
The sadistic goblin priestess is branding new converts to the cult of the Absolute. She is a True Soul - tadpoled, but unaware that is the case. She believes she is communing directly with the Absolute.

 She's one of three leaders in the goblin camp, and an important and powerful member of the Absolute's cult. She's cruel and has a sense of superiority over her own kind. Her offers of help are really a ploy to separate players from their friends so that she can imprison them and watch as the parasite eats them alive.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

Scrying.speaker: Player
Scrying.text: I'm in need of a healer.

Scrying.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying.text: You look spiffy to me. What d'you need a healer for?

Scrying.speaker: Player
Scrying.text: I'm closing some gaps in my group. Everyone needs a healer.

Scrying.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying.text: Well, let me know when you find one. Priestess Gut's better at causing pain than curing it.

Scrying.speaker: Player
Scrying.text: I'm in need of a healer.

Scrying.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying.text: You look spiffy to me. What d'you need a healer for?

Scrying.speaker: Player
Scrying.text: I'm closing some gaps in my group. Everyone needs a healer.

Scrying.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Scrying.text: Well, let me know when you find one. Priestess Gut's better at causing pain than curing it.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: What did you want with that mind flayer?

session_synopses.Scrying:
The goblin king is about to conduct a ceremony in which he speak's with a mind flayer's dead body. He is a hobgoblin on a power trip, but still devoted to his god The Absolute. Like most goblins, he's not greatly intelligent, but a cut above the rest.

Pronunciation: Dror Ragzlin = Drawer RAGS-lin.

Z'Rell = Zuh-RELL. Other prinunciations in actor node field. 

Goblin language words should sound guttural and trashy.When they engage with Ragzlin, the player will experience a brief vision of him with an elf - this is teasing Ketheric Thorm, a later antagonist. Ragzlin will say he's looking for a weapon - the place will realise via narrator or mindmeld with Shadowheart that this is the gith artefact that she has.
session_synopses.Dead: The player interrogates Dror Ragzlin's corpse about Z'Rell, Halsin, and Moonrise Towers. His N+1 info means he can be forced to talk even if the player killed him.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
node_data.text: Ain't you got sumfin' better to do?
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin who doesn't have a lot of respect or time for players who are bothering her while she's trying to mingle with her fellow raiders

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *Decaying legs protrude from the hole - a failed escape, it seems.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: See the legs sticking out of the hole

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *It seems the tunnel collapsed mid-dig and suffocated him. A crooked heart is embroidered on his left shoe.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is crouched and looking intently at the body

PAD_TunnelBlocked.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelBlocked.text: Still blocked - but should be easy enough to clear.

session_synopses.Tunnel: A body is found protruding out of a tunnel in the GOB prison. For patch 6: After pulling the body out, the player can use the tunnel to instantly escape. Patch 7: the player will need to find a shovel to dig their way out, but this will be outside the dialogue.
session_synopses.PAD_TunnelBlocked: The player has pulled the body from the tunnel in the goblin prison, but it's still blocked by debris. The player can attack it if they can do enough damage (vulnrable to Force damge), are small enough to get good levrage, or shapeshifted into a badger. This AD plays to inform the player the way is still blocked and to hint at the solution.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You know Maglubiyet - deity of the goblinoids, hungry for blood and conquest.*

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking advice

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Spiders and worgs are nothing. I can handle myself.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: If you 'ad 'alf a brain, you wouldn't be muckin' around in 'ere at all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: advising

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They've all gone barmy - 'ad their 'eds turned from the old ways by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining the situation, frustrated

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
node_data.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed

session_synopses: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: The pain you suffer will cleanse you - do not fight it.
Penance.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon in hand (it will be either a dagger, a scourge, or a handaxe). Perhaps by his side as he takes a breathe between strikes to speak to the player. NodeContext: First time stirking the player. Excited and joyous - think a preacher building up to a full 'the lord will save us' act in a church.

Penance.speaker: Player
Penance.text: Yelp loudly and dramatically beg for mercy.
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: Succeeding this one is the "positive" outcome because of the reaction to the pain

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: Tch. Beg sincerely or don't beg at all!
InternalNodeContext: No reaction, either because the reactions already played, or because Shadowheart and/or Astarion couldn't be included
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: No reaction, either because the reactions already played, or because Shadowheart and/or Astarion couldn't be included

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Player has finished penance. Speaking to player as if speaking to a loved one.

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.text: Loviatar herself found your performance inspiring and wishes to bless you.
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice intimate and filled with admiration. His goddess has chosen to bless the player - a sacred gift.

PostPenance.speaker: Player
PostPenance.text: What would such a blessing entail?

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: As if speaking to a lover.

PostPenance.text: CinematicNodeContext: This can be anything - for reaching a hand out and gently passing it over the player to holding both hands out and closing his eyes in concentration as he passes on the blessing. As long as it is something that indicates that a spell/blessing is happening, it can be anything. NodeContext: Not voiced
PostPenance.context: CinematicNodeContext: This can be anything - for reaching a hand out and gently passing it over the player to holding both hands out and closing his eyes in concentration as he passes on the blessing. As long as it is something that indicates that a spell/blessing is happening, it can be anything. NodeContext: Not voiced

PostPenance.speaker: Abdirak
PostPenance.text: And on a personal note, thank you. That was positively divine.
PostPenance.context: NodeContext: This is a low, sultry. Almost whispered in the player's ear. Sexy and intimate. But also creepy as all hell.

session_synopses.Penance: This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.
session_synopses.PostPenance: |Abdirak fully completed his penance with a player. It can't be tried again.|

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
node_data.text: Don't let our little pet scare ya, mate. Bloody bugbear couldn't break those bars.

session_synopses: Goblin is telling player of the captive they've placed in the wolf pens.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the crest she bears - the winged serpent of the Zhentarim.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera should show Crest of Zhentarim she is wearing

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's slaves you're buying - not prisoners.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Oh dry your eyes, Ilmater. It's me or a goblin cookpot - I know which I'd choose.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Scornful but not overly so - she's more bored of your moralising than anything. Ilmater (ihl-MAY-ter) is a god of compassion and martyrdom. She has no time for your bleeding heart - she's all pragmatism.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Player
Backup002.text: Sounds like a bloody scrap. Where did you see that?

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: You ain't hear? We sacked Waukeen's Rest and left it to burn.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: Drow flingin' magic, gnolls snappin' off heads. Inn's nothin' but a pile of ash by now.

Guard002.speaker: Warrior Puce
Guard002.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Neutral, not particularly friendly but not hostile

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: She gestures to himself and to you, as if to ask, 'go on, tell me, are you part of my clan?'

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, not drowNodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Unless you got another reason to be here, feck-shite.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player. Dripping with disdain.

Guard001.speaker: Gale
Guard001.text: Let's try to be diplomatic, shall we? Goblins don't come by the handfuls, but by the dozens.

Guard001.speaker: Narrator
Guard001.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Beautiful animal. Does she belong to the Nordiland worgata family?

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: NodeContext: He's impressed. He's a worg expert so your knowledge appeals to him, but he doesn't want to make it too easy for you.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Dumb as a rock, but world class at tearin' the throats outta wee ones, she is.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Rest of her litter's inside, in the pens. Beautiful beasts.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: I've never seen a pack up close - always wanted to.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Be a shame if you came all this way without havin' a look. But I can't let you pass just like that.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Celebratin' a raid, we are. You'll need to wear our war colours.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Said greasily. He's playing a trick on the player.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Nice dab o' this across the mug oughta do it.
Guard001.context: CinematicNodeContext: *He pointed to a steaming pile of worg dung at his feet.*NodeContext: Pointing to worg shit as he says this. Stifling an evil laugh. He's told the player to smear shit in their face.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Scoop up the warm dung and fling it at Olak's face.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: Can flinging dung at Olek make him go blind for combat?NodeContext: Player threw dung in Olak's eyes. This leads to combat.

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Guard002: One of several goblin guards protecting a checkpoint. Grunt type who thinks he's more important than he is. If you humiliate yourself before him, he's gleeful in your misery.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.
session_synopses.Guard001:
All guards at the checkpoint point the player to the guard with this dialog. He is an evil, nasty character who has no reason to go easy on the player. Should ooze disdain. This is the first goblin we meet and their weasly, cruel, wicked nature should stand out.
The goblin will let a non-allied player in only if they smear worg shit on their face. Yuck.

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

Backup_01.speaker: Tracker Fezk
Backup_01.text: 'S good you ain't causin' trouble. Boss means business, now he's got the Absolute in his ear.
Backup_01.context: NodeContext: Tone of false threat - they've been handed a position of meagre authority and are trying to lord it over you.

session_synopses.Backup_01: This guard is lowly backup, but eager to lord a position of authority over anyone they can.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: He can't be dead! I never got any answers out of him!
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblins don't know where the den is.NodeContext: Spike is extremely worried. The palyer killed the prisoner he had to extract information from, and he's certain his commander will kill him for his failure.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.text: She'll kill me. This is it. This is the end... but oh, I'll make you pay before I die.
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.context: NodeContext: Fiercely angry - about to attack the player.

session_synopses.Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom: Small crime dialogue with Spike if he sees you kill Liam.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: You see that eye wotsit floatin' about? Best hope it don't take a fancy to you...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding as if towards the 'wotsit'.NodeContext: Conspiratol tone. He doesn't like the 'device' and takes issue with it.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: ... unless you like playin' hide an' seek when yer tryin' to take a dump.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Crass. Obviously speaking from experience.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It can look all it likes. I've got nothing to hide.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: If that's how you get yer kicks, ain't no business o' mine.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has said they don'tt mind the device watching them. Goblin has interpreted it as having no issue with being watched in the latrine.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: But when yer takin' a tinkle, be sure to wave, eh? The bigwigs at Moonrise love a good show.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost a sly wink at wave. He's joking -  Knows those in Moonrise would be furious.

session_synopses: There's a floating eye moving throughout the camp. This goblin takes issue with it, he feels they are being spied on by their bosses, who don't trust them.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *The foul stench of slaughter turns suddenly sweet through the rat's nose.*

LocalRat_001.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_001.text: *Blood-smell. Life-smell. Not like the great hollow below, which smells only of death.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *A longing for small spaces, stone walls hugging close. Confining. Comforting.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *There is a light here, in the tight space beneath the floor. Secret things that shine.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_001: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp, feeding on whatever offal it finds. When we enter its mind we learn of a cavernous space below that it's constantly in fear of.
session_synopses.LocalRat_002: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp - we can learn of a puzzle hidden in the floor.

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: I'm watchin' ya. Spike promised that any meat that falls off is mine.
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's standing a few paces away from the prisoner.NodeContext: Mean.

session_synopses.Spike_Dead: Speak with dead: goblin torturer in camp. Non-Wyll version.
session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: What? No. Lunkbug, you can't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do what I can.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Please, please don't hurt my Phil, I beg you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Worried you will hurt her beloved.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hurry. Our people won't last in that cave-in forever.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: At ease. Without magic, things feel so peaceful.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A quiet contentment settles in your chest. Perhaps a life without power would not be so terrible.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

session_synopses.02: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Thanks for sharing. I'll keep it in mind.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Seen her run with a barrel under her arm. Just a small one, but enough to blow the drow out.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Someone should grab it. Slaves are never gonna manage with pickaxes.

Mutineers.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
Mutineers.text: Can't go chasing 'maybes' - the sergeant's our ticket in.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: Would you look at that, Kur. Someone's having a listen.
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brithvar turns and notices player. Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Mutineers.speaker: Narrator
Mutineers.text: *A shiver runs through you. Your mind is awash in ancient resentments.*
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Not a mindmeld but a resonance due to duergar's psionic sensitivity.

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers.text: True Soul, no less. What do you think, Kur - should we take Nere's debt off them?
Mutineers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Kur, looking at player

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_03.text: Grey ones make me work soon. Must sleep.
Rothe_03.context: NodeContext: Sighing. She knows there is little time to sleep before their next shift.

Rothe_01.speaker: Narrator
Rothe_01.text: *The rothé chews slowly, its eyes drooping from exhaustion.*

Rothe_02.speaker: Elder Rothé
Rothe_02.text: The Ketheric Thorm. The rocks hear, and tremble.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

03.speaker: Thudd
03.text: Good riddance. Hoon caused nothing but trouble.

session_synopses.03: Pissed off duergar raider who is standing guard while the gnomes are digging up a collapsed tunnel. He is cursing his superior, saying they should just let him suffocate. The player can make use of this and threathen the duergar, saying they will tell the sergeant unless the duergar gives them money.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: ... stuck in Moonrise with a bunch of sadists. Poor bastards.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Inspect the holes.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the odour - the foul scent of carrion crawlers, centipede-like aberrations that feast on the dead.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At one time, these caverns must have been their banquet hall. The creatures are either long gone, or waiting patiently in the darkness.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player inspecting holes

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.text: Hardly the time for a repast. Later, maybe...
PAD_RefuseNobleStalk.context: NodeContext: Spoken to self. Lightly chastising herself for attempting to eat a mushroom at an inopportune moment.

session_synopses.PAD_RefuseNobleStalk: Shadowheart states that she doesn't want to eat the Noblestalk or is not ready for it yet.

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: lava is disappearing from the floor

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem is awakening in the pipe

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: the golem burst out from the pipe and open the grill gate

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: player reaction to the threat

AdamantineGolemSpawn.text: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.
AdamantineGolemSpawn.context: CinematicNodeContext: An adamantine golem crawls from the fires of the adamantine forge and attacks players.

session_synopses.AdamantineGolemSpawn: After a party member opens the valve that pours lava out of on the forging platform, a golem climbs out of the pipes, attacking them.Note: The valve can be activated by (ranged) attacks and spells, so party member positioning is not guaranteed.Note 2: Party members who are not players can activate the valve.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Just leave me, I said. You've done enough damage already.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You don't know what you've done. Leave me be.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Player cured Baelen. She's facing a terrible future.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Player
DwarvenAlchemist.text: I know exactly what I've done. Very entertaining.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You're a beast - you and Baelen  would make fine bedfellows.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Get out of my face. Find some else's suffering to lap up.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

CheckpointGuard_001.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_001.text: *The creature's song rumbles within you, neither warm nor welcoming.*

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: Why not. Spaw's time is done.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*come, then. bring me to Spaw and I will sing its doom*))

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: ((*who is it. what do they want. are we safe*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: Probe your memories. What magic might this be?

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Telepathic mushroom creatures - myconids - inhabit the Underdark. You must be nearing a myconid colony.*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *The corpse twitches in response to the spell...*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: What was your role in the circle?

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Narrator
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: *Like its living counterparts, the corpse speaks in your mind.*

DeadMyconid_Dead.speaker: Dead Myconid Sprout
DeadMyconid_Dead.text: ((*...to grow. to know. to be one with the Circle...*))

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: No need for me to ask how you fared - some of my kin have already made it here, safe and sound.
InjuredGnome.context: NodeContext: A little more relaxed than we've seen her - eyeing us up and impressed with what she sees

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: It's past time we were back in the city. But if you find yourself there, call on us. The Ironhand Gnomes are good friends to have.
InjuredGnome.context: InternalNodeContext: Reputation +1NodeContext: Impressed and grateful. On the mend

InjuredGnome.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome.text: What will you do when you return?

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: Like I say, we Ironhands make good friends.

InjuredGnome.speaker: Thulla
InjuredGnome.text: But bad enemies, too. Some folk are about to be reminded of that.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: You return. Have you changed your mind about the ring?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I cannot change my appetites. Although I am experimenting in reducing them with magic.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps with time, it can be one brain a year instead of one a month...

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I'd like to learn more about the tadpole.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Narrator
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: *An almost childlike joy enters Omeluum's ichor-laced eyes.*

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Open your mind to me, friend. Let us see what lurks within.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Never mind. I'm done with mind flayers touching me.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I see. I will remain here if you decide otherwise.

DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.text: *The monstrosity stares blankly. The voice that echoes within you belongs not to it, but the sovereign.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_003: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome: STATE NODES - first half of dialogue, Thulla is in EXTREME pain, speaking in short, terse sentences.Second half - she's weary but recovering.Thulla is a member of the Ironhand Gnomes, a group of militant gnomish artificers who came to the Underdark to find a forbidden - and extremely secret - formula for runepowder: an explosive of awesome power.Thulla is a true believer in the cause - when her group was captured by duergar, she escaped but picked up a poisoned wound on the way. She's slowly succumbing to poison - initially vague and feverish. If we heal her, she's exhausted but straight back on task, giving us the job of freeing her people.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign_HookHorror: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: Godsdamned dwarf. What are you doing on Gekh's raft?

RaftEvent.speaker: Player
RaftEvent.text: Duergar, like you? Saw his body a way back. Myconids got him.

RaftEvent.speaker: Corsair Greymon
RaftEvent.text: What a load of rothé shite. No way a mushroom killed Gekh.

session_synopses.RaftEvent: The players use a boat to reach the duergar camp. In the middle of the lake, they are confronted by a group of duergar on a raft. Being Drow/Duergar changes the tone of the conversation and makes the persuasion event easier. Having the mark of the Absolute can also make the persuasion event easier.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Pull Nere from the rubble. Time Nere gets what's coming.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Any ideas on how I might do that?

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Some days back, a slave gnome bolted with smokepowder. Handy stuff.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Bet her crew know more than they're letting on - see if you can get 'em to talk.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: Once Nere's out, we'll pound him to powder and take our dues.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: You ain't clan - you got no business here.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.NodeContext: Looks the player up and down with distaste.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Gekh Coal
AD_CombatTurn.text: I am pain, I am torment, I am death.

Henchmen_Surprised.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Henchmen_Surprised.speaker: Player
Henchmen_Surprised.text: Hold up your palms in peace.

Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Lurgan
Squad_Caster_AD_CombatTurn.text: Die, so your carcass can rise!

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Shattered Duergar
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: Hunter... reaver... warrior of... the Absolute...

session_synopses.Henchmen_Surprised: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.
session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I know this design - Shar's faithful wield crossbows like these.

session_synopses.PAD: The player realises that a crossbow found in Ketheric City is not Dueargar make. If they pass a history check, they recognise it as Sharran.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: 'Less you're here to kick some stiffs lake-side, I suggest you bugger off.
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera first pans acros the field of dead, then focuses on the duergar

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spit on the groundNodeContext: He spits on the ground, glowering.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers.text: I hope you're checking them for loot first?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: You gotta be kidding. These trash don't have nothing on 'em but rocks.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Done gawking? Lend a hand or get gone.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: The pushing of the corpse into the lake appears to be handled systemnically, so the camera can pan out and let animation take over.

session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Be welcome in this house. I wait for your commands.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: The robot talks to a new person he hasn't talked to before while in peace mode. He bows.

Automaton.speaker: Bernard
Automaton.text: Command as you see fit, my lord, my liege.

Automaton.speaker: Gale
Automaton.text: Don't get me wrong. I love poetry as much as the next wizard, but using it to command an automaton... seems a bit self-indulgent to me.
Automaton.context: NodeContext: Annoyed he didn't think of it

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

session_synopses.Automaton: This is an old robot guarding the top of a deserting tower. His master programmed him to speak in verse. He talks mostly in iambic pentameter (though sometimes in iambic hexameter) - think shakespearian verse.Translator node: this dialogue is linked to other poems in the game, and uses the same words. For more information, please read the 'Riddles and word puzzles of note' doc!
session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Dry land. My guts'll stop churning now.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives and the captain and players disembark.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Greymon, you shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Spit it up, Morghal. Or you busy choking on that True Soul Nere's prick with Thrinn?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Drugh no. The twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: That's the trouble - he got the gold on him. Thrinn's arm's falling off what with the gnome slaves she been beating.
CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Did I hear right? You keep gnomes as slaves?

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging. Won't find none better.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: But your type got their uses. Let's get those meat-paws to work.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Been wanting a reason to choke the life out of you, shit-for-brains.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: Low rage, about to fight.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

node_data.speaker: Mind Master Fonmara
node_data.text: An outsider. Just what we needed.
node_data.context:
NodeContext: drugning is an expletive (like fucking), pronounced DRUG-ning (g is silent for duergar)

Clan-sen means a duergar from another clan. Pronounced like it is spelled.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard.

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: You've slain the pretender! We knew in our hearts the god BOOOAL was false.
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: In awe of you, rushing to affirm his faith - and absolutely means it

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: But you - we see you. We know you by your true name... MAHKLOOMPAH!
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Kuo-Toa give overwrought, nonsensical names to their gods. Air of great ceremony as he bestows one on you

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.AD_FishChanting: Fanatical chanting at the altar of a murder god, a crowd heard from afar rather than direct dialogue. This dialog has no lines that are spoken by the character - the lines are intended to be subtitles for the SFX
session_synopses.PAD_MagicGone: This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.
session_synopses.HighPriest: The Zealot is a Kuo Toa obsessed with his new god - you. You've slain the 'pretender' he was just as dedicated to only moments before, and he's transferred all that zealotry to you.Mahkloompah = ma-KLOOM-pa.

AtPier_01.speaker: Stone Guard Orgarth
AtPier_01.text: Got my eye on you, gnome.

session_synopses.AtPier_01: Duergar guarding the lakeside enterance to Ketheric City. Extra mean to deep gnomes.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The gnome was under the protection of the myconid circle. They will see you answer for violating it.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: If you cared so much, you'd have cured her already.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The circle's music slows. You recognise the melody as one of shame and mourning.*
