InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The myconids will raise her husk. Life born from death - as penance.*

session_synopses.InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder: Myconid responses to seeing Thulla - the injured gnome - being killed through the dialog.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: Thou hast come. Hee. Hee. Hee-HEE!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *The amulet is heavy, but holds a subtle warmth, like it was left under the sun.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *Suddenly, the metal surges with heat. You feel great power and an overwhelming urge - to laugh.*

EquipAmulet.speaker: Player
EquipAmulet.text: Grit your teeth. Summon your god's wrath.

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You know a fury more beautiful, more devastating than any. It wraps you in a comforting embrace.*
Thou hast done well. For what is a laugh, if not one step toward madness?
Hee. Hee. Hee hee hee hee hee hee. Thou art the one!
Return me, take me home - and thou shalt glow with blessings!

EquipAmulet.speaker: Narrator
EquipAmulet.text: *You feel a chuckle coming on - but it soon fades.*
EquipAmulet.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spirit fades away, player pockets amulet.

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *A giggle almost erupts from your throat. This moment strikes you as terribly funny.*
Mine curse hast become thine. Hehe hehee - alack!

ResistMadness.speaker: Narrator
ResistMadness.text: *Such unbearable happiness. Laughter bubbles within you, eager to escape.*

session_synopses.EquipAmulet: When the player picks up the Monk's Amulet the monk's astral self appears and will start talking with the player. The player can find out who the monk is, what the amulet does. Later, they find that wearing the amulet will slowly drive them mad as they wear it (the monk has no control over this).
session_synopses.ResistMadness: Player has left the camp. A few moments later, they are overcome with an unnatural sense of cheer. If they fail the check, they will fall over in laughter every time they use the amulet's special power that day.The madness has several levels.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: Thank you. Your help was... appreciated. We'll be leaving soon.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still feeling the effects from having been petrified

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: Wizard Dhourn hired us... find a... forge.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: Came across Xargrim... his friend - a fight broke out. He summoned a spectator. Fool.

005.speaker: Petrified Drow
005.text: He escaped. His spectator petrified us... somehow.

session_synopses.005: This drow was petrified by a spectator. And will still feel a bit sick when he's woken up. Disoriented somewhat.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Curious - that stone there's been pried loose.

session_synopses.PAD: The player notices a loose stone in the Duergar Camp.There is a hidden stash underneath.

node_data.speaker: Bonna
node_data.text: Stay on yer own raft.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*smooth-flesh. you are like them*))

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Duergar faces appear before you, one by one, each twisted by zealous cruelty.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: This ain't a show. Go make yourself useful or get lost.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

CaveIn.speaker: Skickpit
CaveIn.text: You've done more than I'd have hoped for. I should never have doubted.

session_synopses.CaveIn: Elevator gnome one-liner if you sent him to be with the others after the mutiny.

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: Bloodied tracks - quite small, too. A gnome found some trouble here.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This feels holy. Consider what the appropriate ritual might be.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *This blade was a warrior's sacrifice to Eilistraee. Blood can only be honoured with blood.*

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_RecogniseStashLocation.text: Looks like the place the Dark Justiciar's letter mentioned. But where's the stash?

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Must be in one of these chests.

session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseStashLocation: The party has read a Harper's letter and has arrived where they expect their stash to be.
session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseWatchword: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap
session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Try to focus. What more can you see?

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The harder you look, the fuzzier the images become, until there is only grey.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Image blurs before greying out/fading to black

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.context: NodeContext: Said with great relief, but tinged with anger

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: Worthless slaves. Your incompetence has been my ruin.
Mutiny.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the gnomesNodeContext: Intense but quietly so.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.context: CinematicNodeContext: True Soul Nere prepares his spell, readying to attack the gnome Meerna. Nere strikes Meerna down with a magic attack, and raises his hand to strike down Beldron.NodeContext: ZHIL loo-NIN! Rising, seething anger. Only the last word should be louder.

Mutiny.speaker: Player
Mutiny.text: Stop! No more innocents will die today, Nere.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: You care for the weak, True Soul. Most curious.

Mutiny.speaker: Player
Mutiny.text: This isn't about them. I just can't stand your face.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: And yet you came to my aid.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: A test - yes, you must be. The Absolute bade you to try Nere's faith.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: Thrinn. Carve out their heart and serve it to the rothé.

Mutiny.speaker: Nere
Mutiny.text: If they are indeed a True Soul, let the Absolute save them.

Mutiny.speaker: Player
Mutiny.text: You wouldn't dare. I'm faithful to the Absolute.

session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.
session_synopses.Mutiny: Dialogue after you destroy the cave-in and set Nere free. Thrinn has been put in charge of getting Nere out, but it's the player who accomplishes it. Nere almost just died from inhaling poisonous gas, so he's very angry. In this dialogue, you determine the fate of the gnomes as well as Nere and the mutinous duergar.

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well. You... did it!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're free - go on.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Free. Yes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Wavering.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I don't know if you heard, but some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: No.
False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And, erm, well... thank you.

session_synopses: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_02: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.

FollowUp.speaker: Sergeant Thrinn
FollowUp.text: I'll be damned. Nere's gone and kicked it.

session_synopses.FollowUp: The player sided with Nere, but Nere died in combat. Thrinn announces her plan: to travel to Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You stare into the eye. Your reflection stares back.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The longer you stare, the more uneasy you feel. There is a presence. You are seen.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closely inspects the scrying eye more intensely

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: Grey ones gone. Good. Will stay here, until it's safe to leave.
Rothe_002.context: NodeContext: Glad captors are gone - good riddance (the duergar could be dead or ordered to go elsewhere)

Rothe_002.speaker: Player
Rothe_002.text: How about breaking through that rubble for me?

Rothe_002.speaker: Deep Rothé
Rothe_002.text: For killing grey ones - yes. I will do this.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Don't think I won't thrash you harder than the rothé.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Something's spooked the dumbshits. So stop your jawin', and get to workin'.

session_synopses.Rothe_002: Panicky and bestial. A one-liner deep rothe speak with animals dialogue. It's being used by duergar to clear rocks, only it and another rothe have been unsettled by strange noises and stopped responding to their masters. It can be calmed so it can return to its work (the act of calming occurs when speaking to the othe rothe, whom this one takes its cues from).
session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.

Spider04.speaker: Lur Fu
Spider04.context: NodeContext: Quickly, rhythmically, like a chant

session_synopses.Spider03: Followup with spiders after they kill their sister Xanta.
session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: Beldron said we'll head back to the city. But the others at Moonrise...

Saved.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
Saved.text: ... I can't bear to think of it.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Laridda reflects on her missing friends, who are trapped in Moonrise.

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

AD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
AD_FoundKey.text: A casting mould. Could put this to use at the forge.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.

session_synopses.AD_FoundKey: Party stumbles upon a mold while exploring the rear area of Grymforge. If they pass the check, they understand it's used at a forge.
session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I'm a deep gnome, you're a drow. You helped me, now you plan to enslave me.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That's not what I want.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: What, then? Torture? Bloodsport? Or perhaps just a good old-fashioned walloping?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd rather know how you got caught.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: My own fault, really. I should have dropped my pack and outrun those bastards. Alas.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.
session_synopses.Dead: This is the gnome's spirit once he's dead. He's still focused on Wulbren, his first love, who he believes to be in danger.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: A drow...? Erm, I mean, glory to you, True Soul.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid).
session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Dry stones line the wall, but the darkness below is impenetrable.*

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning.context: NodeContext: A bit like a spider chirp, but a bit louder, if possible.

session_synopses.InteractWithWell: Dialogue when first interacting with the well.
session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.
session_synopses.AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning: The ettercap feels that someone stepped on its web and lets out a warning screech.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

Dog.speaker: Narrator
Dog.text: *The dog lowers his hackles, his head tilted inquisitively.*
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

Dog.speaker: Narrator
Dog.text: *Convinced that you're harmless, he turns his attention back to the corpse.*
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, barks. The corpse is clearly dead.

session_synopses.Dead: Using Speak with Dead, we are able to talk to the spirit of Gomwick. He was killed by a band of gnolls, but managed to save his dog, Scratch, by forcing him to flee.
session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Away! Speak to Fezzerk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

PAD_HealedOwlbear.speaker: Player
PAD_HealedOwlbear.text: Healed - but she doesn't look much happier.
PAD_HealedOwlbear.context: NodeContext: Karlach: 'I healed you, owlbear--> you still look like you're gonna rip my face off.'

AD_HatchedEgg.speaker: Player
AD_HatchedEgg.text: Owlbear eggshells... an unhatched one would fetch quite a price...
AD_HatchedEgg.context: NodeContext: Speaking from knowledge or experience. The player recognises the egg they've spotted and the price that an intact one could fetch.

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: At least the cub has a fighting chance now.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning; justifying decision to let an orphaned animal cub live.

VB_CubResolution_2P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_2P.text: That, or we've just prolonged its misery.
VB_CubResolution_2P.context: NodeContext: Unconvinced. Wondering if it would've been better to kill the animal.

session_synopses.PAD_HealedOwlbear: A short VB after player heals the Owlbear in gameplay. Owlbear is still dangerous, though. This can happen either before or after the player has interacted with Owlbear. It's meant to give feedback on the fact that the owlbear is now healed, but not to encourage the player to provoke her.
session_synopses.AD_HatchedEgg: The party reacts to coming across some large empty eggshells, from an owlbear. They may recognise the species, or may have already picked up an intact egg.
session_synopses.VB_EnterCave: The player enters a cave that houses an owlbear - a large, aggressive wild beast. They might comment on the stench of half-eaten prey, or note that some tracks they discovered lead into the cave.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_2P: The party briefly reflects on their decision to spare or kill an orphaned owlbear cub.

AD_Boss.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_Boss.text: Gotta be somethin' in this heap.
AD_Boss.context: NodeContext: with disdain. isn't there anything interesting inthis shithole?

session_synopses.AD_GoblinLootsTrash: Checking out a house and finding nothing interesting inside.
session_synopses.AD_Boss: A goblin is scouting the village looking for loot, weapons, something of value

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Carefully wiggle the dagger until it slides free.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Strained by your clumsy technique, the blade snaps in two.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

AD_Cultists.speaker: Andrick
AD_Cultists.text: I can't stop the bleeding, Bry.

AD_Cultists.speaker: Brynna
AD_Cultists.text: Press the wound. Not like that!

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

session_synopses.AD_Cultists: A brother and sister are worried, trying to figure out how to help their older brother (True Soul) Edowin. He's quickly fading. They are lost and lone, but haven't lost faith in the Absolute.
session_synopses.PAD_PostScene: An automated dialog by players, triggered after the scene with the Absolute Cultists in which the True Soul dies is over. The party wonders aloud what the cultists were talking about when they mentioned 'true souls' and 'the Absolute'. They may have a little more context if they already spoke to Sazza, a captured cultist goblin

AD.speaker: Narrator
AD.text: 'Moonhaven'

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Edowin... a True Soul... a Chosen...

session_synopses.001: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won him over previously in the forest, he'll refer to this and speak deferentially.
session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!

session_synopses.AD_OgreKilled: The players have killed the ogress (the bugbear's lover) and he swears revenge.
session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.VB_TakeSussurSap: Voice bark: player takes sussur sap from a tree. SUSS-er. Needed to make a special weapon.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: And deny you the honour of my hospitality?

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm, mm, mm. Fortune favours my belly, for there is no meat more succulent than a stranger's.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll do you one better - I'm one of her chosen disciples.
True

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Indeed? How regrettable, that your meat must go unsavoured.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Now speak or go, before my cravings conquer me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Should suddenly sound all ogre-ish and stupid. He's talking to his stupid brothers.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've seen few other ogres in these parts.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: I follow the scents of blood and gold to all lands fertile, friend.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: And this land proves particularly... fruitful.

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

AD.speaker: Fank
AD.text: Gnome taste good. Like bear.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Hm?

AD.speaker: Fank
AD.text: Hm?

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Oh, for... shut mouth! Head hurt!
AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

session_synopses.AD: Three ogres have a meal time discussion. Chock and Fank are stupid. Lump is smart.
session_synopses.AD_Summoned: Ogres speak ADs when summoned into battle.They are hungry and ready to tear their targets apart

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

session_synopses.AD_MissingPoster: A faded poster of missing children in an abandoned village, indicating an earlier Dark Justiciar abduction.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteRitualScroll: Reflection on the Selunite Ritual scroll found in the Owlbear cave

session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.

VB_InspectCookingPot.speaker: Player
VB_InspectCookingPot.text: Reeks of mugwort. Tastes terrible, but makes some useful potions.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_TrapStart.speaker: Player
VB_TrapStart.text: What in the hells - get back!
VB_TrapStart.context: NodeContext: Surprise and alarm upon triggering a strange booby trap in an abandoned house.

session_synopses.VB_InspectCookingPot: The player examines a large pot in an abandoned house. They may or may not realise it was used for brewing potions, not cooking,
session_synopses.VB_ReadLedger: The player comments that a ledger they just read suggests the existence of a cellar; one they haven't found yet.
session_synopses.MagicMirror: Player finds a talking mirror that seems to be guarding a door to its old master's secret room. It doesn't recognise you as its master, so it challenges you with three questions to see if you're  friend or foe. If you get the questions wrong, it activates a trap to try and kill you. The mirror hasn't been used in a long time - its master died years ago. The mirror speaks in a cracked, broken voice.
session_synopses.VB_TrapStart: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - a magical orb that emerges from a mirrow and attacks them with fire.

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: Chicken?

node_data.speaker: Fank
node_data.text: No. You not chicken.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks. Mistakes you momentarily for a chicken.

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

PAD_NoticeStashSeal.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeStashSeal.text: There's magic keeping this chest sealed; I can feel its aura.

session_synopses.PAD_NoticeStashSeal: Following a passive arcana check, the player comments that a chest discovered at a shrine has a spell cast over it, protecting its contents.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Look what we got here - another little birdie wantin' to fly!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk notices us and calls out to his cronies. (The line is addressed to the goblin raider and scavenger, but Fezzerk's attention is broadly held by the player.NodeContext: Cruel bravado.The goblin sees the player approach and boldly announces it to his cronies - he thinks some fresh victims have just turned up.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Yehehueh! Flap those wings some more, an' I'll feed you a worm!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/look-at context - Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.NodeContext: Greatly amused. A schoolyard bully tormenting the little kid. Projecting his voice a little (Fezzerk calls out to taunt his deep gnome prisoner, who rotates on the sail of a windmill a short-moderate distance off.)
'Yehehueh!' = Fezzerk's distinct laugh (a raspy, mean-spirited slur of a laugh)

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: An' you - hope you got a stomach fer heights!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin turns back to the player (if the gnome inclusion line triggered - otherwise he's facing the player the whole time.)NodeContext: Confident, unpleasant. Turning his attention to the player to deliver a threat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not looking for trouble - just want to pass by.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Heh, funny. That's what our birdie wanted.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking. Refers to the player's previous statement ('I don't want trouble - just want to pass by').

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: ...Release me this instant, you beasts!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Context - the deep gnome yells at his captors as he swings into earshotNodeContext: Panicked, angry. Issuing an ultimatum even though he has no means of following through on it.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: 'Less you wanna join him up there, you'd best pay the toll.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin looks at his hands and tries to calculate a figure with his fingers.NodeContext: Fezzerk mockingly refers to the deep gnome's predicament as he threatens the player. 'Passing by' refers to rotating on a windmill rather than safe passage through the area, in his book.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Cough it up! ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: The idea is the goblin is a bit dim greedy and throwing out a stupidly high number.NodeContext: Fezzerk declares his price. (A ridiculously high sum - questionable whether he truly knows how absurd a demand this is)

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm going to pay nothing, and you and your cronies are going to leave.
True

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Y-you're a True Soul... I didn't know. Wouldn't dare question you, never!

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: We'll, erm, we'll leave you to it.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.
session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin reacts to the decision to leave with slight disappointment.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.text: You'll look good with a few arrows sticking out of your gut!

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You! Not a step closer.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: What happened to your friend?

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: Wait.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: Protect them.

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Edowin. Ed! Please!
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: He's with the Absolute now.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Why are you out here? The wilderness is dangerous.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: We know that all too well. But... the Absolute sent us here.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: We're looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: It... it got her. It got Bry too.
Cultist001_InCave.context: NodeContext: Mourning his sister, who was also killed by the owlbear.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Player
Cultist001_InCave.text: Find the nearest stronghold and report on your mission.

Cultist002_Dead.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_Dead.text: Brynna... a faithful... servant to... the Absolute...

AD_OwlbearDead.speaker: Brynna
AD_OwlbearDead.text: We did it. For Edowin. And the Absolute.
AD_OwlbearDead.context: NodeContext: Amazed and jubilant. She just witnessed her superior slay a dangerous beast.

session_synopses.Cultists: The party encounters two novices of the Absolute , attending to a True Soul who had been leading them through the region. He now lies injured, but recognises us as having been tadpoled. He tells his novices that we are trustworthy, but they aren't so sure. We can convince them to do as we order, and tell them to leave the area or else set out to find the creature that attacked their True Soul leader.
session_synopses.Cultist001_InCave: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, has been sent by his supposed superior to attack an owlbear - a wild creature that killed another cultist. He needs to be be emboldened to attack the beast with a small pep talk. If the player does something to arouse suspicion however, Andrick may realise he's been tricked and turn hostile.
session_synopses.Cultist002_Dead: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, is dead. Here, the player casts a spell to grant limited and temporary resurrection for the purpose of questioning her. From her, they can learn more about the cult's hierarchy, specfically the meaning of the 'True Soul' rank that is frequently referred to. Her ability to communicate after death is limited - cryptic, broken or repetitive answers to a small range of questions. If she recognises her killer, she can refuse to answer or else lie.
session_synopses.AD_OwlbearDead: Two cult novices express jubilation as their leader successfully kills a dangerous wild beast that killed their brother.

session_synopses.PAD: The player sees dead flaming fists and a collapsed tunnel near the Toll House.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: I promise my shield and my sword, Vigilant One. Let them be my courage...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek, prayingNodeContext: Praying

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: He of the Unsleeping Eyes. Grant me the might to carry this burden. Grant me the faith to face darkness without fear.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek, prayingNodeContext: Quietly praying

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: My condolences to you.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: He should never have been here in the first place. I'm the one that talked him into joining the Fist.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ephren is kneeling next to the dead Jacek

session_synopses: Flaming Fist praying over a dead colleague. Jacek = "YAHT-sick."Drow players: Ephren believes you are another attacker, and either initiates attack or you persuade her not to.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Fresh air, at last.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Your boldness is a blessing - I'm in your debt.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Listen close: drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears may be believed.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I must report to the Flaming Fist manip, with haste.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: And you - I must ask again for your aid.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: May I trust you'll see it through?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You'll have to find somebody else for the job.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Damn you. My father's in danger. We cannot turn our backs.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I see your goodwill has limits. Far be it from me to stretch them.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I will seek reinforcements and join you when I can.

FirstThanks.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FirstThanks.text: Come. I'm afraid proper thanks must wait.

session_synopses: Councilor Florrick is working in secret for a dragon in the city of Baldur's Gate. She is acting as an advisor to Grand Duke Ravengard. She should come across as good but no nonsense. SHe is used to getting her way.
session_synopses.AD_FF2: If Yeva is unavailable, Ito calls out that it's the Duke's counsellor trapped in the burning building.
session_synopses.FirstThanks: You speak with Desire after freeing her but before she reaches safety and engages the flaming fist

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor: Party comments on finding the armour of a dead drow in the tavern region.
session_synopses.OxAlive_AD: An ox caught in a stall near a burning inn. He is agitated, a dead goblin at  his feet. This AD plays if the player gets near but dialogue cannot be initiated (say, if they're polymorphed.)
session_synopses.DeadGoblin1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - one of the goblin raiders. He was killed chasing a child through the inn.

session_synopses.Dead: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If killed, she can be interrogated about what she was looking for - in this case, the missing Duke Ravengard.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Player
TieflingScout.text: Take it easy, I'm only disguised as a gith.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: What? Why...? Never mind. I don't want to know.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: That's how you want it... fine.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: You're not like that lot at the bridge. I reckon I can handler you... come on!

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the githyanki's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: You. Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: What easy prey you make, walking right within my blade's embrace.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?
Confrontation.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: Impersonate a fierce gith and refuse him any explanation.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: There is no conviction in your voice. What are you? A deserter? A traitor?

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Unusual runes are etched on the slate, forming an array of arcs and circles.*
ReadingMap.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~[reuse] Player produces slate from intventory

ReadingMap.speaker: Player
ReadingMap.text: Focus on the object. Perhaps you can reveal its secrets.

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Magical energy courses through the slate. You are flooded with understanding.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *A mystical map glows before you, revealing a githyanki refuge inside a temple within the mountain pass.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *The slate also reveals the githyanki's purpose: they are combing the Sword Coast in search of a polyhedric relic of great importance to their queen.*

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.text: I should have ended you when I had the chance.
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.context: InternalNodeContext: She was never a companion

AD_ScoutLeaves.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutLeaves.text: Mrag! That's it - I'm getting out of here!
AD_ScoutLeaves.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced 'mRAG' (means 'shit' in infernal language). The tiefling decides that things are getting too dangerous and runs off while she still can.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.text: A dragon-rider. My kin are hunting - blood will be spilled.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.context: NodeContext: Unnerved at the sight of a dragon flying overhead

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.ConfrontationLaezel:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.Confrontation: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.ZorruFriend_Dead: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelSidesWithGith: |Player manually attacked the githyanki, bypassing the normal flow. Lae'zel is still a NPC. She sides with the githyanki in this combat.|
session_synopses.AD_ScoutLeaves: The tiefling refugee/scout declares she's clearing off when she realises the situation with the nearby githyanki warparty is getting too risky.
session_synopses.PAD_DragonShadow: A dragon flies over the party. They may or may not  recognise it. If they're a gith, they'll always recognise it and suppose that their kin must be operating nearby.

session_synopses.AD_Detour: Sign before the Risen Road detour around SCL.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Cut it out. There's worse than gnolls out there.
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: admonishing a companion, but in a friendly way

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: Nothing we need to worry about.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: How about a dragon? Would that worry you?
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: trying to get a rise out of a companion

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: I'd give it a bloody good fight, that's for sure.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Ha! Only thing you'd give a dragon is bad gas.

AD_RefugeeAlarm.context: NodeContext: Calling for help to companions nearby

session_synopses.AD_Refugees: Dialogue between two refugees who are secretly cultists of Zariel. This dialogue is spoken before the player enters the tollhouse where they are hiding out. If a player enters during the dialogue, they stop talking to address the newcomer.
session_synopses.AD_RefugeeAlarm: A paladin calls to their companions when they see hostile players.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A human man awaits you, a spell crackling at his fingertips.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: [Salazon is crouching behind the shelves with Fire Bolt ready].

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait!

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait - listen!
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *He freezes, waiting on your next word.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Careful. You won't kill me, but you will make me mad.
False
False

node_data.speaker: Salazon
node_data.text: That ain't the pass-phrase!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire bolt is still in hand.NodeContext: Salazon gets up frantically as he exclaims his line.

session_synopses: Salazon is preparing a fire-trap at the entrance to his gang's hideout. We can either sneak up on him or be sneaked up on in turn - either way we have to convince him we should be there or he'll get skittish and blow us all up. In general he's jumpy and suspicious of us, but relieved when we convince him we're a friend. Think an inexperienced guard pointing a gun at us when he's been told to be on alert.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

AD_InvestigationCheck.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: You lot are always making fun of me.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is alive and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: Oh, lad. That just shows we care!

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I do it because it makes me hate him less.

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: Don't just paint faces. People got other parts, too.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Dog_03.speaker: Istor
Dog_03.text: Careful! No stone-scent. No stone-sound. Strange-stone here.

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who recruited me, Rugan.
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: For this entire exchange, Zarys is standing about ten feet above us on a raised platform.NodeContext: She's overseeing the torture of an agent of hers - one who originally recruited her to the organisation. Tone is chiding and also vaguely disgusted - he should have known better.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who taught me rule number one, remember?
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the torturer from behind, the moving aside to reveal Rugan.NodeContext: As if reflecting on 'good old days', but with a harder edge

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: <Bound to a chair> Any moan / gurgle of pain or fear. He's been tortured for quite some time and is too exhausted to scream

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're dead the moment you steal from the Zhentarim.
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: All joviality dropped - flat and icy-cold.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticedFakeWall.text: That wall's an illusion! Hiding what, I wonder...

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: I've been wanting to try this venom...
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.context: NodeContext: (Zar-iss, Sword-har) Your leader just died in combat - dismay, anger.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.text: Shitting hells, will this never end?!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been freed by the player, He is leaving the cave, but on the path he feels threatened by something

Zhent05.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05.text: You seem a nice sort - I'm glad we didn't have to kill you.

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.text: Our visitor's taking out the lights! Fall back!

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: Look - there's no need for this. Free me now and I'll see that my patron rewards you!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: He's trying to get the attention of his captors, trying to be personable and bargain his way free

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: I need only tell her it's a gambling debt - it's happened before!

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: Wouldn't linger down here, I were you - see all that smokepowder?

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: The Flaming Fist won't find nothing here but rubble.

Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent04.text: You don't want to keep Zarys waiting, believe me.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent02_Stage3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage3.text: You're making a bad mistake, my friend. Last chance to turn back.

Zhent06_AD.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD.text: Down into the Underdark. Reckon I'll be old by the time I see the sun again.

Zhent07_AD_Combat.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_Combat.text: We've buried tougher than you. Come on!
Zhent07_AD_Combat.context: NodeContext: A threat shouted during combat.

Zhent04_AD_Idle.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle.text: Wonder if the Fist pay better than this lot...

DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.text: Wait! They've got oil everywhere - and bloody torches!

Zhent01_AD_Idle.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: Bored with his menial task.

session_synopses.Zhent08_AD: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.
session_synopses.Zhent02_CaughtUp: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Idle: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Idle: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Idle: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage1:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.
session_synopses.Zhent06: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.
session_synopses.Dog_01: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.
session_synopses.Zhent01: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.
session_synopses.Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.
session_synopses.AD_ZhentShipmentAgents: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.
session_synopses.VB_Entrance: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.
