session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Welcome: Garias is guarding a lowly gang hideout. ADs as he approaches you to open the door.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Dog_03: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.
session_synopses.Zhent03: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
session_synopses.AD_UseLift: On interacting with a broken elevator.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Trap: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,
session_synopses.Dog_02: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticedFakeWall: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage2: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.
session_synopses.Zhent05: Bellar is a common thug working for the Zhent. We can find him beating one of their own members for incompetence, or waiting to flee the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.
session_synopses.VB_Cellar: Player has descended into a hideout and the person they're chasing has disappeared.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle: Doubting artist has been kidnapped and is now enslaved by Zhentarim. Everything is peaceful around, for now.
session_synopses.Zhent08: Karad is bored, guarding the back of the cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04: Garias is a lowly Zhent recruit left with guarding the gate. He's sullen about it.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage2: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage3: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking her turn.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Idle: Garias is talking to his brother as they prepare to leave their secret gang hideout.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives: The doubting artist warns the player about the explosives inside the Zhent dungeon
session_synopses.Zhent02_Dead: A SwD with Zarys, the Zhentarim leader. She can tell us about the situation in the outpost, and the missing agents and cargo she's waiting for.
session_synopses.PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened: Player has opened a secret entrance hidden behind an elaborate sliding-wardrobe setup.
session_synopses.Zhent01_AD_Idle: Salazon is pacing, packing up ahead of the plan to blow the hideout.

003_PostEA.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA.text: Need any supplies? We've fewer mouths to feed now.
003_PostEA.context: NodeContext: Friendly, with a hint of regret - that 'one less mouth to feed' is dead in the next room

003_PostEA.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA.text: Two. Both stalwarts of Tyr, sworn to uphold justice.

003_PostEA.speaker: Player
003_PostEA.text: I'll take those supplies now - and everything else you own.

003_PostEA.speaker: Cyrel
003_PostEA.text: Oh, you fool. We'll destroy you.

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that the player just cast a speak with dead spell on

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Refugee
Dead_PostEA.text: ... infernal... servant... so long I've forgotten... why...

session_synopses.003_PostEA:
One of a group of refugees who sold their souls to the archdevil Zariel in exchange for the strength to survive their journey to Baldur's Gate. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters, and if they do their souls will be their own again.

This refugee is confident of her chances of survival, but unnerved by the pact they signed.
session_synopses.Dead_PostEA: A speak with dead dialogue triggered when talking to the corpse of a refugee who was killed by gnolls. The dead man had signed a pact with an archdevil before his death.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting speak with dead on a corpse that fell from a platform above

Dead.speaker: Dead Toll Collector
Dead.context: NodeContext: a speaking corpse telling us its name and job

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue with tollhouse worker, initiated when talking to corpse that has fallen down cliffside outside tollhouse. There is a key near the corpse that can be found through perception check or in this dialogue.

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.
session_synopses.AD_CallingHowl: After hyena sees the player, it runs to the nearby pack of gnolls and howls to get their attention.

VB_PostFight_1P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_1P.text: What was that thing inside her?

PAD_HyenaRunning.speaker: Player
PAD_HyenaRunning.text: Watch it - that hyena's going for help!

session_synopses.VB_PostFight_1P: A single player has just finished a fight with gnolls. Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas. Dialogue changes depending on if players know what gnolls are already.
session_synopses.SickHyena_AD_Groaning: Sick dying hyena whimpering in pain: a new gnolls is about to be born from it.
session_synopses.PAD_HyenaRunning: When the party starts the combat with dying hyenas, one of them - healthy hyena - will run away to call the gnolls nearby. This PAD is to ensure the player will understand what hyena is up to.
session_synopses.AD_GnollBorn: A hyena erupts, whining in agony as it dies, and unleashing a new gnoll into the world.

AD_Working.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis
AD_Working.text: We've got to do it all at once. Like... this!

session_synopses.AD_Working:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: How are you holding up, Rugan?
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved after a fight, checking up on his companion

Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.text: I'm fine. And so's the chest, more importantly.
Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat.context: NodeContext: relieved, responding to a companion about his wellbeing

VB_WreckedCaravan.speaker: Player
VB_WreckedCaravan.text: This must be where the gnolls attacked.

Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Olly
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.text: Ah, Rugan... old bastard thought he'd live forever.
Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: NodeContext: wry comment on the death of a companion... sad, but pragmatic

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: By the gods, you're a sweet sight.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Are any of my crew still alive out there?

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: This whole journey's been one grim sight after another. Gnolls, goblins... drow.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: sadly, with disgust and fear on the last word

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Risen Road's more dangerous than ever. You're the first friendly face we've seen since Elturgard.

Agent_001.speaker: Player
Agent_001.text: Elturgard's a long way from here. Where are you heading?

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: We're bound for Baldur's Gate - got some cargo to deliver. But we've a stop to make along the way.

Agent_001.speaker: Player
Agent_001.text: Maybe I should come - see you don't get waylaid again.

Agent_001.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001.text: Thanks. But that won't be necessary. We'll find help at Waukeen's Rest.
Agent_001.context: NodeContext: Turning down an offer of an escort from players. Wau-KEEN's rest is a nearby inn

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Someone must have found the wagon by now.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: grim, doesn't really believe this

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: Only if whoever found the wagon is stupid enough to fight a pack of gnolls.
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: preparing to let someone down

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: So, no. I think help's a long way from here.
AD_BetweenAgents.context: NodeContext: grim, speaking a harsh truth

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.VB_WreckedCaravan: The party character comments on the wrecked caravan. The player might already know about the special chest from the Den Zhent Agents
session_synopses.Olly_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for Olly after he fought gnolls and is the only agent who survived.
session_synopses.Agent_001: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Scratches that size... something powerful made these.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I think they're dragon marks. Better keep an eye out.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across deep scratches in rock. Passing an Arcana check reveals the creature responsible to be a dragon.

Dousing.speaker: Fist Recruit Tristan
Dousing.text: We'll never put this fire out. You're better off helping anyone trapped inside!
Dousing.context: NodeContext: <Standing> Tryign to put out the fire using a bucket

session_synopses.Dousing: A Flaming Fist trying  to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. He's inexperienced and terrified of fire, so he's panicking.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Grand Duke Ravengard could be inside! Don't just stand there - push!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent and focused; slightly annoyed with PC.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What happened to this place?

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Goblins and drow happened.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Impatient; this is really not the time for backstory.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: Now push, damn it!

session_synopses: A group of Flaming Fists are trying to force a way into the burning inn at Waukeen's Rest. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be Grand Duke Ravengard, who they had been sent to protect.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: These bones are ancient. I wonder who they were.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: There are Harper and druid symbols on their equipment - an interesting pair.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across a pair of old skeletons with harper and druid equipment. A successful history skill check will reveal these two were probably part of the Harper/druid alliance that fought against Ketheric's army of Shar. If the player has seen the frescos in the Druid's Circle of the Den depicting the battle between the Sharran troops and the Harpers/Druids, they will automatically jump to the 'Success' node.

session_synopses.AD_Working:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

AD_Working.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
AD_Working.context: NodeContext: Exasperated/angry. Trying to clear rubble (pieces of wood, etc.)

session_synopses.AD_Working:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged.speaker: Karlach
PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged.context: NodeContext: Relieved and self-satisfied, a little tired after raging out

session_synopses.PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged: After Karlach's enrage she will feel a lot more relieved.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You will not be beaten. Try harder - lift.
True

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: Yes! You did it!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player grimaces and aggressively flips the beam right off Benryn. It falls away off-screen.NodeContext: Surprised and elated (player freed him from wreckage)

node_data.speaker: Benryn
node_data.text: Almost... there!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts the beam a couple of inches. He rolls out from under the beam on "There". Player drops it after he's free.

AD.speaker: Benryn
AD.text: Quick, get me out!

PAD_Door.speaker: Player
PAD_Door.text: The heat coming off that door... opening it could spell trouble.

AD_ToWife.speaker: Benryn
AD_ToWife.text: She's not here. Maybe she's all right.
AD_ToWife.context: NodeContext: Hopeful, but not entierly convinced.

session_synopses:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.
session_synopses.AD: This AD plays when Benryn is stuck beneath a fallen beam within a burning building. He is crying out for help - but coughing as he does so, as the building is still on fire.
session_synopses.PAD_Door: This VB plays when players near a door that will explode upon opening. It serves as a warning to players that opening the door will require quick action, suggesting the use of turn-based mode.
session_synopses.AD_Rescued: This AD plays after the player has safely exited the burning inn with Benryn in tow. He is shocked by the scene he sees in the courtyard - blood and corpses everywhere.
session_synopses.AD_Searching: Benryn is searching for his wife in the wreckage left behind by a goblin attack on an inn. She's dead, but he doesn't know it yet.He's on the edge of total panic, but keeping it together enough to try to find her.
session_synopses.AD_ToWife: This AD plays after the player has told Benryn where he can find his wife's body. He doesn't want to believe it, but he knows it is probably true. If the corpse has been moved after players tell him where he can find her, he has a spark of hope - she's not there, so perhaps she is still alive after all.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: What does godmeat taste like? I... I gotta know.

AD_CommandToAttack.speaker: Flind
AD_CommandToAttack.context: NodeContext: a howl in Abyssal - a nasty demon language

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_03: A gnoll in a pack cackles as it waits to attack prey
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.AD_CommandToAttack: The Flind commands her gnolls to attack the cave.
session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls performs blood ritual over the dead Zhentarim agent's body: bites its teeth into the flesh and rips it apart howling in frenzy.
session_synopses.GnollRanger04_AD_Angry: Gnoll snarls furiously after being instigated / attacked by Flind
session_synopses.GnollRanger02_AD_Angry: Gnoll yaps angrily after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.GnollRanger03_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding
session_synopses.GnollRanger01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: The tadpole was tampered with? That complicates things...

PAD_TadpoleDivine.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleDivine.text: Tampered or not, we need to get these things out of our heads. Let's find another way.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleDivine: This VB plays after attempting to get Ethel to remove the tadpole. She confesses that there's something special about it and she can't remove it.Will play on the player who leaves the dialog that reveals this fact, but characters can be fairly opinionated here since they are reacting to knowledge.Up to two characters.

session_synopses.WRLD_CleaningTable_Hag: World Behavior for Auntie Ethel wiping down tables while in Hag form
session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HumanForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in human form tending flowers
session_synopses.WRLD_GettingBloodFromTrough: Timeline scene trigger for redcap getting blood from a trough

PAD_BetrayedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_BetrayedAstarion.text: You gave him up? I wasn't sure you would.

PAD_BetrayedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_BetrayedAstarion.text: He's too dangerous to have around. We'd always be sleeping with one eye open.

session_synopses.PAD_BetrayedAstarion: PAD that plays if you decide to tell the Gur Hunter in the Swamp where to find Astarion (HAG_GurHunter.lsj).  You tell the Hunter where your camp is, the Hunter says he'll take Astarion during the night the next time you go to sleep, then the dialog ends and this PAD plays.Your companion reacts to your decision to hand Astarion over (speaker 2) and then you clarify/justify your decision (speaker 1)

HusbandGraveForcefield.speaker: Player
HusbandGraveForcefield.context: NodeContext: You just tried to touch a coffin, but it has a forcefield, which hits you with psychic damage.

session_synopses.HusbandGraveForcefield: A forcefield surrounds a coffin. Everytime you touch it, it causes more psychic damage.

PAD_TriedTart.speaker: Player
PAD_TriedTart.text: Gods spare me, why did I think eating a second one was a good idea?

AD_TeleportSurrogateMother.text: Come now, Mayrina! Time to go.
AD_TeleportSurrogateMother.context: InternalNodeContext: Leaving with Mayrina, i.e. outside of combat.
InternalNodeContext: Mayrina & hag leave together, Hag is not in combatNodeContext: Mocking tone and wave as you taunt the player.

session_synopses.PAD_TriedTart: Player eats a disguised Hag Tart, not knowing it's truly rotten and noxious. Brave (or foolish) players can eat the tart a second time, deepening their misery.
session_synopses.AD_TeleportSurrogateMother: Fires as the hag grabs Mayrina and teleports to the lair OR Hag is injured and disappears from the fight alone.

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Someone cut these men to pieces. I doubt they had time to scream.
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.context: InternalNodeContext: No idea who brothers are

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

Frog.speaker: Addled Frog
Frog.text: Green leaves. Shallow water. Green leaves. Shallow water.
Frog.context: NodeContext: You're struggling not to attack the player. Chanting this to yourself to keep calm and hold back.

Frog.speaker: Player
Frog.text: What are you croaking on about?

Frog.speaker: Addled Frog
Frog.context: NodeContext: Gritted teeth. Said with effort. Pushing every word out. You're trying not to attack the player.

Frog.speaker: Narrator
Frog.text: *A chill runs up your spine. There is something wrong with this creature. Very wrong.*

Frog.speaker: Addled Frog
Frog.context: NodeContext: Starting to cry with the effort.

session_synopses.Frog: This is a small frog in the swamp lands.She has been twisted by Ethel's magic and is desperately trying not to hurt the player - doing everything she can to hold back. If Ethel is dead, the frog is very cheerful and sing song - hopping about. If they player asks for a reward, she cheerfully spits on their shoes and hops off.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A fetid smell assaults your nostrils. Dead flesh lies below - a great deal of it.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: The well is disgusting and well

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Fresh, sweet-smelling water gurgles gently below.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Soft and idyllic description of the well

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Drink from the well.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The warm rush of power flows through you. You feel stronger, faster - better.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Occurs after drinking from the well

session_synopses: This well sits just outside of the hag's teahouse. When the player drinks from it, they feel a rush of power and gain a positive status (regardless of whether the illusion is up or down). However, once they enter combat with the hag, it turns to poison in their veins.

Illusioncheck.speaker: Narrator
Illusioncheck.text: *A chill runs up your spine. You feel like you're being watched.*
Illusioncheck.context: CinematicNodeContext: Players is shapeshifted - don't show player.

Illusioncheck.speaker: Narrator
Illusioncheck.text: *A chill runs up your spine. You feel like you're being watched.*
Look for anything out of the ordinary.

session_synopses.Illusioncheck: Dialogue covers the transition from the pretty illusion that is on the swamp to the fetid reality.Triggers when entering the area, or when the illusion is disrupted because of combat or because Ethel is dropping her disguise.This means it may play for a Wildshaped player or even a summon or follower.

Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack.text: No, Ethel! I'm sorry! I'll go back! Argh.

session_synopses.Victim_003_AD_HeartAttack: Lorin has been ordered to stay in the corner by the hag. The player has forced him out, and he is absolutely panicking - he knows the hag will punish him. He calls out, begging for forgiveness before clutching his heart as he experiences a massive heart attack and collapses on the floor - dead.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Gods, didn't hear you coming. I know I should head home, but I can't bring myself to leave.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: look up from quietly crying, surprised

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: The thought of putting him in a wheelbarrow and making the journey all over again... *Sigh.*
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: turns back to the grave, arms crossed - then gestures to the coffin. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: I could say a prayer, if you'd like.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Please. Connor used to say only a fool turned down the divine.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Grateful. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: Light wanes only to wax again - and though life fades, memory shall not.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Player has said a prayer that has made you feel much better. Sincere thanks as you hold back tears.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Doesn't know whether husband is dead or not, but knows that you killed her brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.text: ... drove me mad but... loved them... dead now... everyone is... dead.

SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.text: Quick. Get out of here. She won't like me talking to you.
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting down in her chair - looking at her foodNodeContext: Afraid - looking around for the hag. Head low.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.speaker: Mayrina
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: You've a face on you that could turn milk, petal.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.speaker: Mayrina
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: A walk would cheer me up.
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.context: NodeContext: You ask this tentatively. You're desperate to go outside but don't want to upset Ethel.

AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.text: Hush, now! Won't be discussing that again.
AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene.context: NodeContext: Smile as you dismiss the girl's request to leave. Cheery.

Husband.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
Husband.context: NodeContext: Guttural and disturbing. You're a zombie that has a decomposing jaw.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: I dragged my husband here in a wheelbarrow. Buried him. Took everything the hag threw at  me for him.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: And some godsdamned psychopath digs him up? I hate this place. I hate everyone.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: Not quite the outcome intended, but I must say - the technique was excellent.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: The spell is cast - what's done is done.

session_synopses.ResurrectHusband: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Dead:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied: This is an edgecase in which the player talks to Mayrina when the hag isn't present. Mayrina is afraid, looking around for the hag - doesn't want to get into trouble. Sitting down in her chair.
session_synopses.AD_HagSurrogateMotherStartScene: This fires between Mayrina and the Hag in the teahouse before the player has spoken to either of them.
session_synopses.Husband: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterResurrection: The player's found a wand in the Hag's lair and tried to use it to resurrect Mayrina's husband. Unfortunately, it was cursed and he only came back a zombie. The players reflect on using items from evil beings.

Brother_002_AD_Fallback.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: You're in the swamp and want to keep moving. Gruff and impatient.

Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: Your brother has died in front of you.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Bloody hells, she just disappeared. Ain't seen nothing like that before.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue, The hag has vanished and your left terrified. This monster has your sister and the sheer magnitude of the situation is hitting you.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: She could shoot fireworks out of her backside for all I care; the hag has Rina.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your brother is afraid of the hag and you're having none of it. The hag has your sister and you'd fight a thousand of those monsters to save Mayrina - you're pissed that your brother isn't the same.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Will someone please tell me what's going on?

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: It's our sister - Mayrina. She is... well, she was in a bad way after her husband died.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your sister is heavily pregnant and has disappeared - likely to make a deal with a monster - in the hopes of bringing her husband back. Your voice is gentle as you discuss the trauma Mayrina has gone through - obvious that you love her and are worried about her.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Started saying weird things, like how she was gonna bring him back.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your sister is heavily pregnant and has disappeared - likely to make a deal with a monster - in the hopes of bringing her husband back. You're scared but are hiding it beneath anger and frustration.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Next thing, she's gone looking for the hag. Of all the stupid things to do.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: You're terrified for your sister and her child and are struggling to justify her reasons for disappearing. You think she's being foolish and naive.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Demir
Brothers_Recruitment.text: We haven't seen her since, and no good ever came from dealing with a hag.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: None of this matters, all right? We need to get her back. And fast.
Brothers_Recruitment.context: NodeContext: Your brother keeps talking and you're getting more angry and scared. You need to leave and find your sister - you're terrified of what will happen if you don't.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Player
Brothers_Recruitment.text: You're on your own. I have enough problems.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: And we've no need of a mouthy bastard.

Brothers_Recruitment.speaker: Johl
Brothers_Recruitment.text: Come on, Demir. We'll make our own way.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.Brother_002_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.Brothers_Recruitment: The main dialogue for Demir and Johl. In their post ambush dialogue, the player has sided with them and the hag has disappeared. They want to save Mayrina but are overwhelmed and ill-equipped to deal with the situation. Player can accompany them or tell them that the player will handle it alone. The player can also abandon them to their fates.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.
